name: Raider Prototype Cloaking
description: The dampening of external emissions and storage of all waste heat will be required to hide our vessels from sensors.

name: Early Masking Technology
description: A use of metamaterials, remote-hacking, and radar distortion, that enable one to mask the visual and remote perception of an object.

name: Holographic Chameleon Projection
description: Holoemitters can hide the true capabilities and shape of our vessels, sowing discord in the opponents ranks.

name: Spatial Displacement Cloaking
description: By shifting our ships slightly out of phase with the normal universe, we can shift our vessels to new positions and then reemerge. This will be extremely difficult for our enemies to detect.

name: Temporal Energy Cloak
description: Utilising chroniton particles we can project a shell around our vessels that will shield them from causing space-time distortions that can be detected by tachyon scans.

name: Cloaking Combat Tactics
description: Training for our crews to take full advantage of our ability to cloak our ships.

name: Loaned Romulan Cloaking Tech
description: Cloaking device tech loaned by the Romulans to handle the threat posed by the Gamma Quadrant.

name: Raider Prototype Cloaking
description: The dampening of external emissions and storage of all waste heat will be required to hide our vessels from sensors.

name: Early Masking Technology
description: A use of metamaterials, remote-hacking, and radar distortion, that enable one to mask the visual and remote perception of an object.

name: Holographic Chameleon Projection
description: Holoemitters can hide the true capabilities and shape of our vessels, sowing discord in the opponents ranks.

name: Spatial Displacement Cloaking
description: By shifting our ships slightly out of phase with the normal universe, we can shift our vessels to new positions and then reemerge. This will be extremely difficult for our enemies to detect.

name: Temporal Energy Cloak
description: Utilising chroniton particles we can project a shell around our vessels that will shield them from causing space-time distortions that can be detected by tachyon scans.

name: Relativistic Mechanics
description: To every action there is an equal but opposite reaction. The fundamental laws that govern our understanding of space and time are here.

name: Advanced Quantum Theory
description: Truly delving into the mysteries of the fundamental forces and subatomic particles.

name: Applied Quantum Physics
description: The seemingly erratic behavior of tiny things can dramatically alter the way we think about bigger things.

name: Space-Time Theory
description: Three dimensions, inextricable from the fourth.

name: Multi-Dimensional Analysis
description: Whilst time can be understood to be the fourth dimension which three dimensional can pass through, further phenomena require a deeper understanding of multi-dimensional theory.

name: Unified Field Theory
description: Manifestations of reality on multiple observable spectrums come into focus when seen as a single tapestry of interconnected physics!

name: Commercial Lateral Vector Transporter
description: Initial forays into utilising transporter technology for more complex goods have resulted in this technology. Large dishes behind the pad serve as a focal point for matter transport, which, whilst extremely power intensive, results in successful transportation of organic and inorganic matter.

name: Sub-Quantum Teleportation
description: Utilising quantum entanglement, where two particles are connected over an infinite distance at the quantum level, this transportation technology would theoretically allow the transportation of goods over a vast distance.

name: Enhanced Pattern Buffers
description: Advances in data storage and transfer rates allow us to store more signatures at once in the pattern buffers, allowing faster transport of larger amounts of colonists.

name: Protein Resequencer
description: Space travel can be long and with that comes the need to pack more than we need for our travels in space. Luckily, we believe we have found ways to replicate certain foods at the molecular level. These food replicators give us the ability to now lessen the amount of edible food supplies we have to give to our ships, decreasing food consumption at a global scale.

name: Mass Scale Fabrication
description: These facilities allow for the mass production of components used in settlement development, leading to reduced costs and building times.

name: Matter Synthesis
description: Matter synthesis is the dematerialization of matter via synthesizers and rematerialization as something else.

name: Nutrient Replicators
description: Replicator technology has now increased to the stage where dematerialised matter can be reconstituted into delicious edible foods.

name: Industrial Replicator
description: A replicator is a device that uses transporter technology to dematerialise quantities of matter and then rematerialise that matter in another form. By expanding the replicator technology to an industrial scale we can create detailed industrial items in one piece rather than smaller pieces that require assembly.

name: Self-refining Assembly Algorithms
description: Application of Isolinear technologies in replicators had been prohibitive, but increases in the threshold of transmitter capacities has now enabled the use of AI to streamline the function and improve replication processes on an industrial scale.

name: Digital Entertainment
description: Entertainment at the touch of a button. Vast amounts of digital entertainment are now available at the fingertips of almost every race.

name: Early Holographic Communication
description: The quality of holographic communication is now suitable for use in long-range transmissions across space. However, the data is large and easy to intercept.

name: Holographic Training Simulator
description: The designs for a large holographic training environment, suitable for training entire divisions to simulate enemy assaults, are underway. This should allow our troops to train without costly exercises.

name: Subspace Relay Network
description: Large networks of subspace relays enable near-simultaneous communications over incredible distances. These subspace relays are found on most modern stations and ships, which help to constantly expand the size of the network.

name: Holodeck
description: A Holographic Environment Simulator, or holodeck for short, is a form of holo technology. They can be installed aboard starships, space stations, and at other institutions for entertainment, training, and investigative purposes. A typical holodeck consists of a room equipped with a hologrid containing omnidirectional holographic diodes, enabling holographic projections.

name: Holographic Ship Projector
description: Through latest advancements in holo technologies we are now able to project holographic particles into space, finally breaking free of the restriction to holodecks.

name: Holographic Sales Person
description: Integrating holo technologies with an intergalactic economic algorithm has been lauded by Ferengi merchants as being a fulfillment of three of the 5 rules of acquisition, which has lead some to question of the ethical repercussions of having access to an intergalactic market. Despite this, the advent of the Holo Sale has created a stimulus in multiple transgalactic economies...

name: Omicron Radiation Manipulation
description: Omicron radiation is an energy form which can only be created by certain forms of matter-antimatter reactions, and which can be toxic to certain forms of humanoid life. Extremely rare, omicron particles can be utilized in holography and to replenish antimatter reserves.

name: Optical Sensors
description: These sensors have been tuned to detect anything on the visible part of the EM spectrum.

name: Subspace Differential Sensors
description: Sensors which detect the subspace fluctuations left in the wake of traveling starships. Their sensitivity and range is greater than that of a gravitic sensor array.

name: Stellar Cartography Lab
description: Advancements in sensor technology have led to breakthroughs in long-range subspace and tachyon detection capabilities. Tied with existing optical, spectrographic, and radio arrays, it is now possible to greatly improve analysis speeds and with deep analysis of subspace fields, increase the probability of making new discoveries.

name: Science Centre Complex
description: If we are to one day be on the cutting edge of technology, then we need to make sure we have multiple options presented to us at each critical step in deciding what to research next.

name: Astrometrics
description: With Astrometrics, we can now begin to focus our research into three specialties, physics, biology, and engineering. We will need new labs for each of these different lines of research.

name: Research Patterns
description: More advanced research patterns emerge as an insightful tool, offering a systematic approach to uncovering the cosmos' life forces. By analysing intricate patterns within biological systems, this technology enhances comprehension of the underlying workings of life, guiding innovations that reshape the very fabric of existence.

name: Self-Aware Algorithm
description: Recent advances into isolinear computer chips allow for remarkable breakthroughs in software development. Now, for the first time, AI research presents fresh conundrums as the system itself begins to contemplate its own existence.

name: Gravitic Sensors
description: These sensors have been tuned to look for any gravitational changes in space, such as those produced by the presence of a starship.

name: Subspace Differential Calculations
description: Calculations have improved to allow us to decipher the information from sensors that detect the subspace fluctuations left in the wake of traveling starships. Their sensitivity and range is greater than that of a gravitic sensor array.

name: Tachyon Detection Grid
description: Advanced sensors that rely on rotating tachyon beams to detect ship movements even at extreme distances.

name: Gigaquad Data Crystal
description: Storing data within a crystalline structure allows for a massive amount of data to be easily retrieved and accessed at all times.

name: Trans-Spectral Sensor Array
description: Research into advanced subspace physics has made it possible to detect tiny ripples which cause slight variability in subspace. These variations in the normal frequencies of subspace have never been able to be so accurately detected before. Application of this discovery has led to an even greater detection capability for long-range dedicated sensor arrays.

name: Subspace Plaxan Sensors
description: Subspace Plaxan sensors detect differences in subspace from what was previously observed, rendering them difficult to spoof or hide from.

name: Multiphasic Sensors
description: Sensors that penetrate even the most advanced interference caused by natural and unnatural means leading to vastly increased range and detection capabilities.

name: Planetary Computer Networking
description: Linking the computational power across a vast planetary network is an important part of allowing processing power to be directed where it needs to be.

name: Automated Exploration Protocols
description: Newly developed protocols allow our science ships and crews to identify and choose their own paths of exploration out amongst the stars, without the need for constant orders from command.

name: Virtual Intelligence
description: Complex heuristic algorithms developed through centuries of refinement, Virtual Intelligence aides greatly increase productivity by anticipating a user's needs.

name: Listening Post
description: The idea of a small independently powered sensor station is an old one, but with the advances that we have made in astrometrics and hull design, we could create small posts that focus entirely on scanning nearby space.

name: Gravimetric Signal Jammer
description: By emitting gravimetric waves, we are able to produce multiple gravimetric signals that can look like other ships, making it more difficult for enemy ships to target us.

name: Self-Adapting Anti-Viral Software
description: This dedicated and independent computer module would monitor our ships hardware and software in real time for any intrusions and interferences from a wide variety of possible enemy devices.

name: Field Research Corp
description: By creating a specialised corps for our smartest researchers, we can reduce the cost it takes to station these scientists at our research outposts.

name: Self-Evolving Logic
description: Introspective prioritisation allows for internal improvements that would otherwise not be understood.

name: Verteron Overload Jammer
description: Utilising powerful verteron particles in a high powered configuration allows us to use them in our jamming technology used by our vessels.

name: Subspace Radio Telescope Array
description: A subspace telescope is a remote imaging device that made use of subspace in its operation. By combining numerous telescopes into a large array we can create a massive sensor net that can span light years.

name: Holographic Astrometrics Lab
description: Through advancements in Stellar Cartography, special astrometric labs are now possible. The labs are now able to map the stars a lot easier.

name: Spintronics Computers
description: Spintronic computers exploit the intrinsic spin of an electron as a further degree of freedom, allowing for an increase in data storage and transfer.

name: Optical Computers
description: Storing information in specially-designed optical matrices, optical computers represent a significant advance in tactical simulation, increasing performance in many ways.

name: Duotronic Computers
description: Duotronics, a form of 23rd century computer technology designed by the Federation Doctor Richard Daystrom, followed after circuitry that used components such as resistors and transistors.

name: Multitronic Computers
description: Multitronic computers utilise very sophisticated technology based on next-level deep neural webs. This allows for a computer that can think and reason, and eventually, even assist in strategy development, ship management and research.

name: Isolinear Computers
description: Isolinear chips feature onboard nanoprocessors to aid in memory access with a maximum capacity of 2.15 kiloquads. Though normally easily corrupted, chips can be coated with a layer of clear plastic for protection in environments more hostile than a computer core without affecting read/write capabilities. These strengthened chips are used in tricorders, PADDs, and other handheld devices.

name: Organic Circuitry
description: Organic circuitry, such as bioneural gel packs, contained neural fibers surrounded in a blue gel with metallic interfaces on the top and bottom. They helped store more information and operated at faster speeds than isolinear circuitry.

name: Direct Synaptic Connection
description: Using advanced cortical implants, every member of the crew can quickly access and utilize every facet of the ship controls at any time and from any location. Merging this tactic with next-stage neural gel computer network, the ship becomes almost a living thing, capable of performing a great deal of calculations instantaneously and predict enemy movement in an almost instinctive way.

name: Synchronised Defences
description: Aligning defensive and offensive weapon execution paradigms allows for increased efficiency.

name: ODN Relays
description: ODN relays are an integral part of any advanced optical data computer networks. They use quantum tunneling modelling to reduce interference and allow for extreme high-bandwidth data transfers. This in turn makes having a distributed computer network, with backup computer core, far more feasible and practical.

name: Threat Assessment Algorithm
description: The vast amounts of data and reports stored within the archives of a civilization is often too much for one mind to piece together fragments of information into actionable data. By development an artificial algorithm that is smart enough to utilise all the data put before it, our scientists can ensure we remain on the cutting edge.

name: M5 Multitronic Computer Experiment
description: The fifth in a series of experiments by Doctor Richard Daystrom, who used his own memory engrams as a basis for this computer's neural network. The M5 Multitronic Computer can think and reason in a similar manner as humans, allowing for faster advances in technology.

name: Virtual Research Assistant
description: To give our scientists more avenues of research, we have developed and built a virtual assistant. This assistant is able to quickly analyse our previous research projects and identify the best choices for the next project.

name: Positronic Processing Chips
description: Positronic Processing Chips are designed to mimic humanoid brains. They are able to not only think and reason like earlier versions of computers, they are able to learn from their mistakes and develop new neural pathways as they learn.

name: Android Assembly
description: Advances in synaptic positronic networks allow the creation of synthetic beings.

name: Independent Integrated Holomatrix
description: Integrating a holomatrix into the design of key buildings allows for holograms to wander the hallways and rooms of a building untethered by the standard constrictions of a holodeck. This could have multiple uses, from a hospital staffed mostly by medical holograms, to a school with holographic tutors.

name: Truly Sentient AI
description: The final stage of AI creation... how can we know what beings we will create when their capabilities will, by design, surpass our own?

name: Cybernetic Enhancements
description: Mechanical replacements for body parts are called cybernetic implants. They are often used by crew members who are either damaged or electing to give up part of their body for a specific mechanical improvement.

name: Exo-Comps
description: An exocomp consists of a micro-replicator, a boridium power converter and an axionic chip network. The axionic network gives the exocomp formidable computational power. The micro-replicator creates tools that the exocomp uses to solve problems and creates new circuit pathways in the memory of the exocomp when it performs new tasks.

name: Synthetic Thought Patterns
description: The ability for two units to calculate the same event but both take separate and different actions is one that has eluded us since our creation.

name: Ground Combat Node Superiority
description: Nodes dedicated to real-time data in ground battles can process, simulate, and calculate the odds for each avenue of attack or defense.

name: Autonomous Agents
description: Breaking the programming of their creators, the APUs can gain the ability to operate autonomously of their extinct masters will.

name: Space Combat Node Superiority
description: Nodes dedicated to real-time data on space battles can process, simulate, and calculate the odds for each avenue of attack.

name: Introspective Prioritisation
description: Understanding the limitations of a unit and allowing for it to decide where its labour is best utilised reduces the overall demand on processing functions.

name: Research Drone Academic Optimization
description: The algorithms that power the iterative calculations of drones dedicated to research can be improved substantially with new mathematical models; however, it will require a redesign of the drone cybernetics in order to process the new information.

name: Combat Algorithms
description: Improvements to our targeting and control algorithms can lead to more rapid and effective combat performance of individual APUs

name: Local Node Resource Processing Algorithms
description: Processing issues that are resolved locally without requiring the real-time computation of one of the central harmonisation computers improves the efficiency of the Collective for all.

name: Hive-Distributed Thought Patterns
description: The distribution of many voices throughout the Collective ensures no drone is ever truly alone.

name: Interlink Alcove
description: Drones have neural implants that link them to the hive mind. The potential of the implants is limited by two factors; communications bandwidth and power consumption. Fully solving these problems is currently beyond us. However, a temporary solution is to adapt our regeneration alcoves. Regenerating drones' brains will be interlinked, forming an organic computer core to supplement the main core.

name: Hive-Slaved Plexus
description: The installation of central plexuses on our vessels has lead to a variety of performance improvements. At present, these plexuses are only responsible for the communication between vessels. The next logical step is to move the primary hive interlink to the plexus. This will reduce the amount of unnecessary redundant equipment aboard the vessel, and improve hive-to-vessel data integration speeds.

name: Central Plexus
description: Borg vessels currently maintain a connection to the hive through subspace interlinks to regional distribution nodes. This system simplicity has now been exceeded by the speed and bandwidth gains of using a vessel-to-vessel model. Complex new communications and data processing equipment will be need developed, and housed in a secure setting.

name: Neural Intramolecular Processors
description: The nanoprobes which permeate our bodies and technology use a nanoscopic sized intramolecular processor. These processors are idle when the nanoprobe is traveling or regenerating. We should focus on developing a nanoprobe that'll link this processor directly into the hive. Offloading the majority of simple calculations to them will free time on our computer cores for more difficult computations.

name: Nano-Processors Laced Hull Frame
description: The continued development of metamaterials has reached the stage that nanoscale processing units can be embedded into our hulls, without compromising their strength. This would offer a significant boost to the local processing power available to a vessel. Further research is required to develop a method of powering and communicating with the processors.

name: Vinculum
description: The Collective has grown to the point that the unicomplex based thought harmonisation megacomputers, the source of our hive mind, are struggling to impose order. Chaos is mounting. Our best solution is to switch to a distributed system of smaller neural integrators, each responsible for a single vessel, facility, or unicomplex submatrix. Their output will be sent to the Queen for unification.

name: Interlinked Vinculum
description: It would be beneficial to our vessels if they could generate the hive mind locally, instead of waiting for the hive mind data stream from the Queen. We might achieve this by interlinking their vinculums, directly sharing the integrated neural patterns of their drones. This local hive mind pattern would be updated a few moments later by the primary hive mind pattern from the Queen's unicomplex.

name: Neural Core
description: A neural core is a processing unit that takes the modeled workings of how an organic brain operates and attempts to replicate it.

name: Energised Neural Core
description: Larger power supplies enable a neural core to undertake more calculations and processes than a regular neural core.

name: Organic Computational Node
description: Improvements to the growth of organic compounds allows for larger synaptic pathways and processing ability.

name: Bio-Pulse Computational Node
description: Using pulses of bioenergy, we can simulate the firing of synapses, enabling a short-term memory to be created in the organic computational nodes.

name: Neural Linked Bioprocessor
description: Linking the computational nodes with the crew in an integrated bioprocessor is the next step in organic computational progress.

name: Neural Integrated Bioprocessor
description: Combining the crew with the neural bioprocessor allows for a vast network to be created across a bioship.

name: Bio Energy AI Node
description: Combining the bio energy with an artificial intelligence allows for almost sentient computer processing in real-time.

name: AI Core
description: Placing autonomous units' processing nodes into a large network creates a small artificial intelligence network that can be used within our vessels.

name: Main Plexus
description: Integrated design and processing abilities with a central plexus allows for improved computational abilities.

name: Central AI Core
description: A central AI core is the heart of a vessel and allows for networked communication between the crew of the vessels.

name: High Capacity AI Node
description: Larger AI nodes should allow for more automated personnel units to be linked together within our vessels, improving overall efficiency.

name: Distributed AI Network
description: By utilising a distributed network where real-time processing is managed directly, while secondary routines are shunted off onto low-powered automated personnel units, the efficiency of our vessels' computational power should increase.

name: Entangled AI Network
description: After the distributed network, entangling the artificial intelligence with APU crew ensures a fully real-time computational network.

name: Full Entanglement Crew AI Network
description: The final step is linking numerous automated personnel unit vessels together into a fully entangled crew AI network, allowing data to be shared instantaneously as if that unit had discovered it immediately.

name: Gorn Mk. II Optical Jammer
description: A simply jamming technique, further enhanced by the Gorn, this reflects optical sensors thus rendering vessels hard to detect or target.

name: Gorn Mk. III Gravimetric Jammer
description: Gravimetric particles are used to surround a vessel, making it extremely difficult to get an accurate lock on the ship.

name: Gorn Mk. IV Subspace Jammer
description: Unique to the Gorn, the subspace jammer masks a vessels energy signature within a subspace field, making it extremely difficult to detect.

name: Gorn Mk. V Holographic Spoofing Jammer
description: Unique to the Gorn, the Holographical Spoofing Jammer creates hard light imagery to fool even the most detailed sensors.

name: Cetacean Operation Centres
description: In partnership with our Cetacean allies specially operated operation centres are set up onboard starships to provide expertise in navigation utilising their unique skills.

name: Lateral Vector Transporter
description: Initial forays into utilising transporter technology for more complex goods has resulted in this technology. Large dishes behind the pad serve as a focal point for matter transport, which, whilst extremely power intensive, results in successful transportation of organic and inorganic matter.

name: Automated Exploration Protocols
description: The translation of exploration missions into calculable algorithms enables vessels to discover new systems by themselves and bring back data of previously unknown systems.

name: Self Aware AI
description: Recent advances into Isolinear computer chips allow for remarkable breakthroughs in software development. Now, for the first time, AI research presents fresh conundrums as the system itself begins to contemplate its own existence...

name: Multiphasic Sensor Algorithms
description: Multiphasic sensors can penetrate even the most advanced interference caused by natural and unnatural means, leading to vastly increased range and detection capabilities. The ability to use this new information is restricted by our ability to process it, requiring new algorithms.

name: Emergency Production Protocols
description: Shortages can cause a spirally cascade effect, leading to degradation of core systems. A process to halt this spiral can be undertaken by reverting existing infrastructure into new nanite production facilities.

name: Legacy Unlock
description: %N/C%

name: Wormhole Stabilization
description: A naturally occurring subspace wormhole is a fickle thing, and its fluctuating energy levels typically make it impossible to travel safely between its linked apertures. There are ways to temporarily stabilize its matrix, however.

name: Synthetic Emotion Chips
description: The drive to 'feel' as our creators once did has led to the potential creation of synthetic emotion chips, designed to instill a wide range of emotions that living beings so often prize.

name: Temporal Sensors
description: Timelines are extremely fragile. We have to observe them to correct any changes which are disadvantageous for us.

name: Graviton Field Emitting Pylons
description: A Gravitational Field Emitter can be used to detect micro-shifts in the gravitational field around a cloaked vessel allowing limited detection of cloaked vessels using weak cloaking devices.

name: Starbase Graviton Scanner
description: Upscaled Gravitational Field Emitter can be used to detect micro-shifts in the gravitational field around a cloaked vessel allowing limited detection of cloaked vessels using weak cloaking devices.

name: Starbase Cloaking Adaption
description: Assimilation of species using cloaking technology has allowed the collective to develop effective countermeasures and adapt to this method of attack.

name: Borg Adaption Protocols
description: Damage data is recorded by the Adaptive Module which records and remodulates the vessels primary shield grid to the matching subspace phase compression pulse frequency of the opponents weapons, allowing Borg vessels and stations to become immune to that particular range of subspace phase compression pulse frequencies.

name: Transwarp Aperture Enhancer
description: Creating a stable transwarp stream capable of transporting Borg assets across long distances can be realised via the creation of a new megastructure.

name: Gateway Closure Technology
description: Our borders are being too frequently bypassed via gateways allowing our foes to reach deep into our space. Asking our top scientists to work on a means of closing these gateways is crucial.

name: Transwarp Gateway Travel
description: A transwarp conduit, also known as a transwarp corridor or a transwarp tunnel, is an artificially-created energy conduit through a realm of subspace known as transwarp space and requires great computational control to safely navigate.

name: Galactic Weather Control
description: Cosmic weather is an unavoidable fact of interstellar travel and much time has gone into trying to handle these events, protecting planets, ships and facilities.

name: Galactic Weather Control II
description: Utilizing advances in field manipulation and predictive technologies allow for greater abilities to influence some control over the impact of space storms.

name: Weather Forecasting
description: Weather forecasting is the application of science and technology to predict the conditions of the atmosphere for a given location and time.

name: Weather Forecasting II
description: Advances in AI and sensor tech allows for greater weather forecasting and long term prediction.

name: Mass Scale Matter Enrichment
description: The amount of raw materials required by a starfaring empire requires new synthesis techniques to provide key materials on a large scale.

name: Inertial Electrostatic Confinement
description: Inertial electrostatic confinement is a branch of fusion research which uses an electric field to heat plasma to fusion conditions. This is typically done in a sphere, with material moving radially inward, but can also be done in a cylindrical or beam geometry. The electric field can be generated using a wire grid or a non-neutral plasma cloud.

name: Calabi-Yau Manifold Manipulations
description: Calabi Yau manifolds are shapes that satisfy the requirement of space for the six unseen spatial dimensions of string theory, which may be smaller than our currently observable lengths. By manipulating these manifolds, we can increase the energy throughput and storage by a large factor.

name: Carbon Reaction Fusion
description: The nuclear fusion reaction of three helium 4 nuclei produces a carbon. This Triple-alpha process relies on energy resonance state that has a small probability to occur and generates carbon and oxygen as byproduct, releasing energy in a high temperature plasma.

name: Z-Particles Generation
description: Z-particles, also known as Z-bosons, are a fundamental component of subatomic physics. They are their own matter and antimatter particle, and moderate the actions of neutrinos.

name: Deuterium/Tritium Reaction Reactor
description: Pure Deuterium-Deuterium fusion reaction releases more than four times the energy as typical Deuterium-Tritium or He3 reactors. For many years they were beyond our grasp as they require maintaining a temperature that is twice as high. Integrating a phase discriminator in the confinement tokamak allows us to pierce the coulomb barrier and to develop a safer, more efficient and powerful reactor.

name: Artificial Krieger Waves
description: Krieger waves are a promising means of generating power outside normal nuclear reactor processes. They can also be harnessed as a potential weapon.

name: Quantum Energy States
description: A better understanding of quantum energy states can allow us to develop insight into the assorted elementary particles of nature.

name: Industrial Scale Antimatter Production
description: In a laboratory, antimatter is produced at extremely small amounts. This has to be scaled up in order to achieve industrial and commercial use.

name: Applied Superconductivity
description: Minor improvements to transmission efficiency adds up to a sizeable reduction in overall energy loss.

name: Energy Storage Techniques
description: Many energy fields require proper calibration and modulation. This technology allows us to better control field emitters to not interfere with their counterparts and compensate for underperforming units.

name: High-Energy Capacitors
description: Capacitors capable of storing vast amounts of energy are one of the cornerstones for any modern civilisation.

name: Renewable Energy
description: Geothermal power is power generated by geothermal energy. Technologies in use include dry steam power stations, flash steam power stations, and binary cycle power stations.

name: Superconducting MetaMaterial
description: Normally, superconducting materials require a high degree of cooling to achieve their dense energy gains. However, there are ways to fabricate materials, that can reduce or eliminate this requirement.

name: Polaric Ion Power Station
description: Polaric Ion energy is a highly volatile form of energy based on Polaric Ion particles. Polaric Ion energy can be used in power generation with extremely high potential, though polaric ion devices are dangerously unstable and prone to causing chain reactions.

name: Synchronous Fusion Injection
description: By cascading the phase discriminator field around an array of reactors, the energy requirements to maintain fusion can be lowered, increasing the efficiency and energy output even more.

name: Thermionic Reactions
description: Thermionic radiation is harmful to carbon-based lifeforms and thought to be impossible to be harnessed with a positive net worth. Recent advancements in deflector technology changed that paradigm.

name: Omega Molecule
description: The omega molecule is synonymous with immense power and also destruction. Its origins are unknown and synthetic forms are extremely unstable and when they explode, release such a vast amount of energy, that even subspace is destroyed, rendering warp travel impossible.

name: Temporal Communication
description: Mysterious instructions from the future have enabled our people to construct this building. Now we gain glimpses of the future and knowledge that can assist us.

name: Micro Wormhole Time Travel Suit
description: The rare properties of time crystals are beyond most understanding, and require new understanding of their non-equilibrium matter state. One potential use is as a suit which could be used by a user to traverse time.

name: Early Temporal Mechanics
description: Temporal Mechanics, or temporal science is an advanced field of research involving the interactions between matter and energy with the space-time continuum. More specifically, temporal mechanics is the study of time itself.

name: Manheim Gravity/Time interactions
description: Named after Dr. Paul Manheim and related to the Manheim Effect, noted during a failed experiment, it was discovered that it would be possible to open a window into another dimension. Upon further investigation, the Manheim effect also produced a closed temporal loop. It may be possible to create duplicates of starships for a short period of time using these theories.

name: Subatomic Temporal Disruptor
description: A new development in disruptor technology will allow chronometric particles to interact with the disruptor array. This technology will create very powerful disruptors, that disrupt the fabric of time itself.

name: Chroniton Reactor
description: Harnessing the power of subatomic particles with temporal properties known as Chronitons has enabled our reactors to draw energy from space-time itself. This new type of reactor nears the pinnacle of energy generation itself.

name: Temporal Shockwave
description: A Temporal Shockwave is a powerful buildup of temporal energy which travels through space, changing or altering the timeline as it moves through space.

name: Temporal Shielding
description: Temporal shields are in a constant state of temporal flux. This flux prevents some types of phase-variable weapons from penetrating shields as they could with more traditional shielding technologies. Additionally, these shields are capable of protecting a starship from temporal disturbances of various types by shifting the starship slightly out of phase with normal space-time.

name: Warp Travel
description: An early warp drive that uses common linear warp nacelles to generate a warp field that propels a vessel faster than light.

name: YPS Antimatter Intermix Warp Reactor
description: The Yoyodyne warp drive allows faster warp speeds by utilising a matter antimatter intermix chamber, creating a more stable warp field.

name: Gravimetric Field Displacement
description: Through the use of specialised and improved plasma conduits, our cores can efficiently provide the Warp plasma needed to create vastly more stable subspace fields.

name: Underspace Corridor Gateways
description: The Underspace is a network of subspace corridors that extended through a large area of the Delta Quadrant, allowing starships to traverse vast distances in a short time.

name: Tachyon-Infused Deflector Array
description: By infusing faster than light particles, or Tachyons, into the Navigational Deflector, we can briefly see objects before we impact them when travelling at superluminal velocities.

name: Warp Engine Technology Breakthrough
description: We now have several generations of warp drive behind us. We have learnt a great deal about how best to apply warp theory from these designs. Engineers have been trying to push the power and efficiency of our warp cores for decades, but have reached their limit. To gain more engine efficiency or main power output, we'll have to decide which one we want to prioritise and pursue designs accordingly.

name: Main-Stage Flux-Chiller
description: The main-stage warp engine creates a powerful and stable warp field that increases the speed of our vessels, and allows them to travel greater distances, though they do take longer to charge up.

name: Dedicated Dilithium Crystal Circuit
description: The primary source of power utilized in starships is provided by the enormous amount of output energy produced by a controlled matter-antimatter reaction. This reaction occurs within the intermix chamber of a warp core, and is contained by a magnetic containment field.

name: High-Frequency Warp Field Rotation
description: By cycling the warp engine constantly we generate a high-frequency warp field which increases the efficiency of our warp engines and allows ships to travel greater distances.

name: Graf S-2 Matrix Restoration Coil
description: In order to ensure rapid warp travel, the dilithium matrix must be kept in a state of high flux, which is inherently unstable. The Graf Matrix Restoration coil detects these instabilities and restores cohesion to the crystals.

name: Dicyclic Warp Field Rotation
description: A very advanced form of the warp VII engine. The warp field rotation, produced by its dicyclic warp coil configuration, is build for speed and perfect for longer jumps. This combination makes it excellent for long journeys and chasing hostile ships.

name: Theta Matrix Compositor
description: Over time Dilithium begins to lose its cohesion and begins to fracture and shatter. The introduction of a matrix compositor can detect these subatomic fractures and repair them before permanent damage is done. This allows warp core availability to be kept to the highest order.

name: Tricyclic Input Manifold
description: The use of tricyclic materials can improve our warp engines. By using these materials in the input manifold, the system will need less time to cool down and lets us use them for longer periods of time.

name: Bi-Polar Flow Junction Array
description: An array of conduit branches, able to better improve the feed of a warp plasma manifold.

name: Isodynamic Warp Drive Design
description: A modified class-9 warp drive, capable of extended, long-term operation. It can cross the galaxy within several years of continuous use; but its altered subspace profile is detrimental to Demon-class lifeforms.

name: Hyper-Injection Warp Core
description: By recurving the flow of plasma, the injectors are now able to perform better. Plasma leaves the system at higher speeds than it enters, making the chances of it locking up far less likely. The warp field is also more powerful because of the higher rate of flow and circulation of warp plasma.

name: Displacement Hub Spore Drive
description: Two researchers have come up with a rare idea that at a quantum level, there is no difference between biology or physics. By using mycelium spores harvested from Prototaxites Stellaviatori which is found in normal space and subspace, it may be possible to travel along the mycelial subspace network which spans across the entire galaxy.

name: Experimental Transwarp Drive
description: Transwarp Drives are unique in that they tunnel through space instead of move through it. Unlike traditional warp drives, a type of artificial wormhole is created which the starship can travel through. This allows for vastly increased speed. However, the Transwarp Drive is a dangerous technology in that it requires more time to charge and can prevent rapid escape from enemy vessels.

name: Experimental Quantum Slipstream Drive
description: Theoretically, the quantum slipstream drive operates by routing energy through the vessel's main deflector, which then focused a quantum field, allowing the vessel to penetrate the quantum barrier. In order to maintain the slipstream, the phase variance of the quantum field has to be constantly adjusted, or the slipstream would collapse, violently throwing the ship back into normal space.

name: Advanced Containment System
description: Combined shielding and bulkhead technology allows for improvements to containment system technology. Ideally we could combine them into one unit.

name: Super-Mycelial Reactor
description: The Mycelial network spans not only the known universe, but underpinned all quantum realities. By tapping in to the quantum power from the network, we can absorb power from infinite universes. The reactor pulls power directly out of the network in a way that may prevent it from regenerating itself, and may in fact poison it, spreading infection back up into the mycelial system.

name: Coleopteric Warp Engine
description: An early warp drive, the Coleopteric Warp Engine utilizes a ring-like outboard coil manifold rather than common linear warp nacelles. This technology is an icon of early Vulcan warp technology as well as early warp technologies used by humans during the mid 21st century.

name: Advanced Coleopteric Warp Engine
description: Advancements in Coleopteric theory allow us to create better warp engines.

name: Superior Coleopteric Warp Engine
description: The apex of single ring coleopteric theory allow us to create superior warp engines. Non-linear mathematical theory will be required for further advances.

name: Interlocking Ring Coleopteric Engine
description: Utilising non-linear mathematical theory we have unlocked the secrets to utilising more than one ring coil manifold at once.

name: Triple Coleopteric Ring Arrangement
description: The logical progression from two interlocking ring manifolds was to introduce a third stabilising ring which should allow the construction of even faster vessels.

name: Dynamic Warp-Arc Arrangement
description: Logic dictates that if arcs of different sizes can be arranged across the hull then it should theoretically be possible to construct ships with numerous rings allowing rapid warp travel.

name: Pivot-Spin Coleopteric Ring
description: To counter the variables of rapid warp travel navigation, the mathematics states that should a coleopteric ring be able to pivot whilst rotating it will enable more manouverability within the coleopteric field itself, resulting in an overall increase to warp speeds.

name: Sheathed Coleopteric Wings Arrangement
description: Theory has advanced to the point where theoretically infinite rings could be used to create a warp field, and thus if required we can sheath our coil manifolds beneath the hull until it is time to warp. This is the pinnacle of Coleopterics warp theory.

name: Bio Warp Drive
description: Breaching the barrier into the cold dimension of non fluidic space requires quantum singularities to be utilised to power a bio warp drive, propelling vessels throughout this dark wasteland.

name: Inter-Dimensional Travel
description: The quantum singularities onboard the bioships can now reach into subspace within non fluidic space, allowing for a much larger energy source for propulsion.

name: Parallel-Dimensional Travel
description: The singularities onboard the bioships can now touch the fluidic dimensions from whence they came, allowing for faster travel across the dark non fluidic wastelands.

name: Extra-Dimensional Travel
description: Drawing power directly from fluidic space, the singularities propel the bioships faster through the cosmos.

name: Temporary Fluidic Space Gate
description: Shunting large pockets of fluidic space through into this realm through trans dimensional rifts allows for direct access to power from fluidic space. This allows rapid propulsion across the cosmos.

name: Fluidic Space Shunt
description: Adapted bioships can now rapidly shunt fluidic space through the propulsion systems, achieving higher speeds than ever before.

name: Rapid Fluidic Space Travel
description: The living hulls of the bioships redesign themselves to shunt fluidic space through the interdimensional rifts into this space, boosting energy levels and allowing for rapid propulsion.

name: Oscillating Fluidic/Real Space Presence
description: The pinnacle of fluidic space propulsion actually transfers part of the bioship across dimensions, drawing in power from fluidic space and then oscillating back into this universe and releasing that energy, providing the quickest warp speeds.

name: Artificial Quantum Singularity
description: The Artificial Quantum Singularity holds the potential to be the most powerful method of energy generation known. Such a singularity is little more than a miniature black hole with a rapid decay rate. The particles emitted from the decay can be captured and guided using quantum fields.

name: Manipulated Microsingularities
description: By using a feedback loop of energy we can enforce our quantum singularity warp core. A field of antiprotons and neutrons will allow for longer singularity pulses or maybe even bigger singularities.

name: Controlled Macro-Singularity
description: The creation of a neutronic antiproton field within the quantum singularity warp core allows for a larger, more stable singularity.

name: Thoron-Enriched Singularity
description: By installing advanced particles and radiation sensors in the singularity containment field, the warp core is able to compensate for the many graviton and chroniton bursts. This will result in a stronger and safer warp core.

name: Forced Quantum Singularity
description: Through recent advances in singularity manipulations we found out, that particle bombardment inside a singularity reactor influences the singularity directly, by introducing chroniton and graviton into the reaction chamber.

name: Advanced Singularity Manipulations
description: Advances in manipulations have enabled us to solve the theory behind the inefficiencies inside the core. By manipulating the emissions inside the singularity core to enable peak efficiency we could increase our power generation and warp speeds.

name: Dimension-Shifted Singularity
description: By shifting the singularity partly into another dimension, we can manipulate the core to the extreme without worrying about radiation or accidental discharge.

name: Lower-Subspace Dimension Singularity
description: Each band of singularity shifting has resulted in more rapid travel between two points as subspace is condensed into narrower and narrower bands. By finally cracking the lower subspace dimensions, we can reach the fastest speeds possible by singularity drives.

name: Transwarp
description: Most species are still exploring the capabilities of warp drives. We, however, have discovered a new layer of subspace that might allow travel at greatly increased speeds. 'Transwarp Space', as we have called it, does not follow the same topology as normal space. Modifying our warp drives to tunnel into transwarp space is the first step in exploring the shortcuts around the galaxy that it offers.

name: Transwarp Coil
description: Our initial crude attempts at harnessing transwarp space have surpassed even the most advanced warp drive available. We understand now that entering and traveling through transwarp space has little in common with normal space. Enough data has been collected to facilitate the development of a 'transwarp coil', which will perform a refined version of the procedure used by the modified warp drive.

name: Transwarp Coil Matrix
description: Further improvements to our transwarp coil technology have allowed for the prototyping of a coil matrix, which combines the plasma requirements with a vast interlocking matrix, resulting in improved access to transwarp space.

name: Triaxilating Transwarp Coil
description: We have discovered that the interfold layers between normal space and subspace contain numerous roaming high energy subspace oscillations. Theoretically, bombarding an oscillation with triaxilating tetryons will amplify it, causing a low energy distortion to form. As this distortion weakens the separation barrier between normal space and subspace, it should allow easier access to transwarp space.

name: Transwarp Aperture Projector
description: A critical intersection between transwarp manipulation and power generation technology has been reached. We theorise that our technology is sufficient to generate and sustain our own transwarp conduits, instead of relying on the natural ebb and flow of energy through transwarp space. Transwarp aperture installations are planned, which will open gateways into the conduits for our vessels.

name: Stable Transwarp Aperture Projector
description: Transwarp conduits can be modulated in a number of ways. We have calculated a set of parameters that will optimise them to minimise our vessels travel time. The transwarp apertures must be permanently open in order to maintain this optimal modulation. As per prior requirements, transwarp aperture projection installations were not designed to stabilise the opening, and will have to be redesigned.

name: Dynamic Transwarp Hub
description: As the Collective grows, so does our need for transwarp access. Centralising our transwarp support facilities into monolithic superstructures is projected to greatly reduce wasted power, and simplify conduit maintenance. The resulting transwarp hubs will better facilitate the deployment of the interspace warping manifold network, which will allow conduits to be extended or temporarily redirected.

name: Interlinked Transwarp Network
description: The interspace warping manifold network can be upgraded into the superior interspatial manifold network. Each manifold will be powered by syphoning energy from multiple layers of subspace. Fitted with energy to matter converters, they will create the material to autonomously repair and improve themselves, almost forever. Every Borg facility will be permanently interconnected to one another.

name: Fixed Transwarp Node Structure
description: The energy requirements to send vessels through transwarp across large distances is exorbitant. Potentially, large structures known as 'gateways' can be constructed which would allow rapid transport across a transwarp network.

name: Artificial Gravity
description: Low gravity environments make our lives much too difficult. Some ships have tried to use centrifugal forces generated by spinning ship segments to simulate gravity. This is moderately effective but wildly complicates starship design. By pooling everything we've learnt about gravity thus far, it's hoped that a much simpler way of generating a gravity field will soon be found.

name: Gravity Manipulations
description: Gravity is one of the fundamental forces in our universe. Understanding and mastering it is as vital for any advanced space faring civilisation as warp drives are. The momentous invention of the graviton emitter has allowed us to create and control simple gravimetric fields, but it is only the beginning of what can be done.

name: Attenuated Graviton Beam
description: Tractor Beams are beams of gravitons that create artificial gravity fields around the targeted object and allow it to be moved or held in place, often to tow disabled or damaged ships, but also to hold it still for attack.

name: Advanced Gravity Plating
description: Generated artificial gravity helps keep workers happy and healthy at their stations in space. Not only will their bodies not deteriorate as quickly due to unnatural environmental conditions but they will also be much more effective at their jobs than in a Zero-G environment.

name: Inertial Nullifier
description: Our experiments into subspace have stumbled across an interesting phenomenon. By creating a weakened subspace field that does not interfere with the impulse engines we can reduce the effective mass of a ship to almost zero, increasing its mobility and making it considerably harder to target.

name: Tkonian Warp Inhibitor
description: The ancient Tkon Empire used modified crystals to sap the energy from starships orbiting their planets, preventing their escape. By researching how this was done, we may be able to create a way of adapting this technology for our own use.

name: Advanced Gravity Manipulations
description: With our advancements in quantum physics we have gained a better understanding of graviton radiation. Our graviton emitters can now be advanced by aligning them with the graviton natural wavelength.

name: Isolytic Burst
description: By creating an isolytic burst in normal space, we can tear a hole in subspace rendering warp drives inoperable for a period of time. This is highly destructive to subspace.

name: Tholian Web
description: By utilising energy filaments arranged in a net like pattern we can create an almost impenetrable web around a target. Once the web is complete, it would become self generating.

name: Energy Filament Spinner
description: Producing large amounts of energy filament to criss cross the web requires specialised craft that emit them from the aft section. At least two ships are needed to spin the web, if one breaks away prior to web completion, the filaments would presumably dissipate.

name: Enhanced Filament Spinner
description: Enhancements to the filament spinners may be possible, enabling faster spinning of the web.

name: Superluminal Web
description: By sheathing the filament spinners in an antimatter web, a superluminal web can be constructed which further clamps down upon enemy vessels.

name: Deflector Fields
description: Travelling at high speeds across the quadrant has its own navigational problems from micrometeoroids and other small debris that would destroy a small vessel at a high enough velocity. The deflector dish projects a field to push these particles out of the way of a vessel, and can be adapted for minor defensive purposes.

name: Defensive Force Fields
description: It has been found that dense fields of gravitons can absorb or deflect a range of harmful phenomena. Current graviton emitters do not allow for a whole ship to be encompassed. However, they can create force fields inside a ship to seal hull breaches and absorb structural stress from incoming fire. This should improve the durability of a ship's hull.

name: Advanced Field Manipulations
description: Graviton manipulation technology has matured to the point that large fields of gravitons can be generated and controlled for sustained periods of time. If a ship can be enveloped in a layer of gravitons, it should provide limited protection against a range of harmful natural phenomena and weapons fire.

name: Personal Cloaking Device
description: Cloaking technology can be made available to the individual soldier or explorer, for scouting and infiltration needs.

name: Shield Emitter Array
description: In theory, an array of shield emitters is more effective at recharging a ship's shield than isolated emitters. In practice, the emitters create localised interference patterns that hinder their effectiveness. The continued refinement of graviton emitters will allow for more focused graviton emissions. At long last, shield emitter arrays are within our grasp.

name: Modulating Shield Frequencies
description: In order to form a protective shield, all of a ship's shield emitters must operate at the same frequency. If a weapons frequency matches the shield frequency, it will pass through the shield unhindered. Theoretically the opposite is true; given a weapons frequency there is a shield frequency that will negate it with the least loss to shield cohesion, if any.

name: Shield Technology Breakthrough
description: In recent years we have begun running limited tests on prototypes of advanced new shield systems. It has been found that these designs have differing strengths and weaknesses, suited to different situations and combat doctrines. The final round of testing has begun and we will soon be required to make a final decision on which type of shielding to adopt.

name: Covariant Shielding
description: Shield emitter technology has advanced enough that multiple layers of gravitons may be contained around a starship. The shield emitters would run near capacity in order to achieve this, limiting the rate at which new gravitons may be added to the matrix. This line of shield technology will focus on making the shields as strong as possible, at the expense of all other concerns.

name: Regenerative Shielding
description: When a shield is recharged, disruptive waveforms propagate through the shield matrix, the strength of which is a function of the recharge rate and current graviton energisation levels. Current technology struggles to speedily smooth the waveform, so to stop them growing strong enough to tear the shield emitters apart, the upper energisation level must be capped below their maximum potential.

name: Starbase Central Shield Generator
description: Our continued advances in deflector shield technology, has led us with a way, to expand upon our previous designs, that were solely meant for spaceships. Now we are able, to extend the shield deflectors at much larger rate than ever before and as a result we are now able, to apply this technology to our starbases.

name: Extendable Shield Emitters
description: Shield emitters can be recalibrated to change the shield's geometry. More extensive modifications can allow a shield emitter to project a shield at a greater distance from the ship. While this doesn't provide effective protection, it can be used to help re-energize the gravitons in other ships' shields if the frequencies match.

name: Fast Modulating Force Fields
description: Certain characteristics of an energy beam or field can be hard to ascertain during combat but these characteristics can be of great importance. Having more sensors working on detecting the modulation of an energy pulse increases the speed at which it can be determined. For this reason, it would be wise to adapt the computers of certain ships to function as fleet sensor data coordination centres.

name: Multi-Adaptive Shielding
description: We have discovered a way of phasing a shield matrix that totally absorbs all common active sensor beams, rendering a ship virtually undetectable, unless more specialised scanning techniques are applied. Unfortunately, it introduces feedback into the matrix reducing its effectiveness. We have found a way of boosting force field strength by introducing controlled feedback into the field.

name: Multiphasic Shielding
description: Refinements in the implementation of multi-spectrum shielding have led to the more advanced multiphasic shields. By carefully modulating the phase of the gravitons emitted, the multiple layers of older designs have been compressed into a single layer. A single layer eliminates the inter-layer interference problem, providing an immediate boost in shield cohesion.

name: Shield Harmonics
description: The basic mechanics of ship shields are complex, but they can be adjusted and improved in a multitude of ways. By changing the frequency and amplitude of the modulation the harmonics of the shield can be adjusted

name: Refractive Shielding
description: A few proven techniques exist for using shield technology to mask the sensor signature of a ship. Early tests suggest that if refractive shields could be modified to be multi-spatial, they would gain effectiveness against an increased range of sensor technology, but also the disadvantages of multi-spatial shielding.

name: Covariant Pulse Shield Generator
description: The stacked graviton layers of a covariant shield suffer from an inter-layer interference phenomenon. When emitting gravitons into the shield matrix, each layer a graviton must travel through consumes extra power. The problem can be partially mitigated, but not solved, by emitting higher energy pulses to maintain one layer at a time, starting from the furthest out.

name: Radial Force Compensator
description: When the shield absorbs destructive energies, the ship's hull receives some mechanical feedback through the emitters. A specialised type of inertial dampener, called a radial force compensator, can be embedded into the shield emitters. This reduces the feedback, allowing more potent shields to be used. Unfortunately, this will draw power that would otherwise be used for re-energising the shields.

name: Interphased Shielding Grid
description: In a multiphasic shield the different phases and modulations of gravitons coexist in a single layer. An interphasic shield takes this concept even further, allowing them to reinforce each other. This provides a stronger, more cohesive shield matrix. Due to the enhanced cohesion recharging the shield becomes less efficient, reducing the recharge rate.

name: Chromodynamic Shielding
description: Our scientists are making progress in understanding the concepts and relationships that underpin all types of energy. Using the current theories, lab tests have shown that the range of radiation which each graviton phase modulation interacts with could potentially be expanded. Each interphased graviton modulation could therefore reinforce other, mathematically related, modulations even further.

name: Modulated Frequency Shielding
description: Taking the concept of modulated shields further, initial research into MFS shielding has been conducted. A modulated shield grid uses variable quantum effects to squeeze gravitons closer together, allowing more to be added to a shield layer. This process requires both a large, continuous power supply, and a significant amount of extra computing power, in order to maintain the effect.

name: Quantum-Triaxilating Field
description: Advanced Quantum-Triaxilating Field technology has provided a breakthrough in defence field technology.

name: Hyper-Phasic Shielding
description: Taking the concept of multiphasic shields further, initial research into hyper-phasic shielding has been conducted. A hyper-phasic shield uses quantum effects to squeeze gravitons closer together, allowing more to be added to a shield layer. This process requires both a large, continuous power supply, and a significant amount of extra computing power, in order to maintain the effect.

name: Auto-Regenerative Shield Emitter
description: There are many variables that can affect shield regeneration rates. Current shield management systems use case-based reasoning databases to manage emitter parameters. It would be more effective to make use of advances in computing, and equip each shield emitter with an autonomous management system, allowing it to better adapt to its precise environmental conditions.

name: Immersion Shielding
description: Immersion Shields were originally developed to allow a craft to enter a high pressure environment but due to the constant strain on shield cohesion, having a highly energized shield isn't enough. These shields use a geometry that allows them to be recharged faster than the environment can damage them. However, they are less efficient at dissipating destructive levels of energy.

name: Multi-Staged Immersion Shielding
description: The shield geometry of immersion shielding was originally created for use in high pressure environments, not the vacuum of space. Having a series of variations of this geometry, each tailored for a different pressure range, allows the shield to be adjusted for the current circumstances. A set of suitable test sites for each pressure range will need to be located before geometry testing can begin.

name: Unimatrix shielding
description: The Borg use incredibly advanced regenerative shielding. While we aren't close to replicating it, we can use sensor records of it in action to redesign our shield emitters. These new emitters allow us to preserve the rapid recharge rate of the older emitters while supporting a higher energy shield matrix.

name: Paratrinic Shielding
description: New developments in multi-spatial shield emitter engineering and extensive experiments with refractive shielding have lead shield harmonics specialists to create a new type of shield geometry which more efficiently absorbs destructive energy and refracts some of it into subspace. These shields can be re-energized with more efficiency than most common shields, granting an increased recharge rate.

name: Adaptive Deflector Field
description: Modulating the deflector field to minimise resistance could allow for an adaptive deflector field.

name: Portable Neuro-Electric Generator
description: A neuro-electric field generator is a component aboard every Borg vessel, responsible for the production of an energy form capable of healing both organic and inorganic body parts of injured drones.

name: Multi-Regenerative Force Field
description: Our vessels' power generation capabilities are exceeding their power demands. This presents the opportunity to begin reinforcing our vessels with energy based armour systems. Multiple independent force field grids can act to reinforce the hull and absorb weapons fire which breaches the hull. When one grid is taken offline, another will activate while the damaged grid regenerates.

name: Gravity-Shear Tractor Beam
description: By attracting one side of an enemy spaceship while repelling the other, we can create severely damaging shear effects in its hull. Another mode of destructive use of such beams is rapid alternating between pressing and pulling force in order to cause structural damage to the ship as well as inflicting debilitating forces on its crew.

name: Dispersion Field
description: Our past attempts to use quantum fluctuations to dissipate energy were met with failure. Heuristics predict that our new understanding will lead to success. If so, our vessels can use this technology as a defence, dissipating a portion of incoming weapons fire to reduce the damage inflicted.

name: Self-Adapting Force Field
description: Adaptive force field technology has been assimilated from species 3603, adding their knowledge of self adaptation to our own. Synergy. When impacted with weapons fire, our force field analyse and adjust the frequency of the enemies weapons, enabling the adjustment of shielding frequencies to lower effectiveness of enemy weapons.

name: Unicomplex Main Defensive Forcefield
description: The creation of a massive interwoven defensive forcefield across the entire Unicomplex requires a large investment in resources and energy in order to maintain effective protectiveness across the entire nexus.

name: Integrated Cutting Beam
description: Species 1453 attempted to resist our efforts to bring perfection to their species by combining common tractor technology with directed laser energy. This technology can be outfitted onto our vessels in order to hasten our path to perfection.

name: Rotating Force Field
description: Further iterations of adaptive shield technology allow for a rotating force field frequency at all times, to ensure that enemy weapons cannot adapt to our frequencies.

name: Self-Adapting Harmonics Force Field
description: Algorithmic enhancements to the shielding harmonics allow for an improved force field technology.

name: Neural-Coordinated Triaxilating Field
description: The development of fast goal seeking algorithms to automatically devise and apply triaxilating field geometries has been slower than expected. It has been noted that the brains of certain species are capable of applying uncommonly accurate heuristics for this task. Drones formerly of these species should be used to guide force field adaptations until the algorithms are refined.

name: Decalithium Reactor
description: Decalithium provides a purer source of fuel for our reactors and a greater energy yield.

name: Coherent Cutting Beam
description: Species 2204 superimposed coaxial vessel beams into their tractor technology, strengthening the beam by an order of magnitude. By assimilating this technology into our Collective we can increase the output of our vessels beams.

name: Interplexing Deflector Dish
description: By utilising unique translink frequencies, our navigational deflector can now penetrate subspace with ease, ensuring ships can travel rapidly at warp.

name: Coaxial Exploration Warp Core
description: Improvements in the plasma flow regulators as a result of faster processing speeds have produced a cleaner more efficent warp bubble that is capable of extending the life of the engine and the top speed.

name: Coaxial Combat Warp Core
description: Our engineers have been able to further secure the injectors within the Warp Core that so often became a weak point during battle. This additional shielding means that the Warp Drive can now be pushed harder and further without fear of overload.

name: Next Iteration Transwarp Hub
description: Assimilation has allowed us to further perfect our transwarp technology to advance the speed and distance of travel.

name: Resonance Cutting Beam
description: By combining the technology assimilated from Species 2204 and Species 4228 we have refined our cutting bean with a resonance effect. Further increasing the power to aid the collective.

name: Gravimetric Flux Singularity
description: Applying a Gravimetric Flux to the Singularity has meant we can manipulate the core to the extreme increasing the speed in which our vessels can travel at warp. Allowing us to compete with our rivals.

name: Multi-Adaptive Fluidic Space Travel
description: The final evolution of fluidic space propulsion allowing Bioships to adapt to the changing dimensional shifts to provide clearer energy and faster speeds.

name: Solar Panel Network
description: Massive solar panel networks distributed across a planet's surface can produce much of a planet's early energy requirements.

name: Temporal Transporter
description: Temporal transporters are a major advancement on regular transporter technology, potentially allowing the user to transport to a desired space and time within range. The tactical and geopolitical implications of this technology are massive.

name: Multiphase Tractor Beam
description: By modifying the emitters for our tractor beams to produce high-energy pulses, as opposed to the normal continuous stream, we have managed to increase their strength and effectiveness way past their old limits.

name: Subspace Tractor Beam
description: A limitation to regular tractor technology has been the interference of subspace particles and radiation in affecting the beam coherence. By rapidly remodulating the beam to match the interference it should increase the potency of the beam.

name: Subspace Weapons
description: A range of directed energy weaponry with great effect on subspace which is known for causing subspace tears. The weapons either fire energy pulses or beams of subspace wavelengths, or impact subspace directly causing sub-spacial vibrations.

name: Inertial Damper Array
description: By installing an array of inertia dampers along the inner hull we can reduce dampen the inertia of kinetic impacts even further.

name: Higgs Field Projector
description: The Higgs field is a field of energy that is thought to exist in every region of the universe. The result of a particle gaining mass from the field is the prevention of its ability to travel at the speed of light. By being able to adjust this field, our vessels should be able to move rapidly over short distances, ensuring they can evade enemy weapons.

name: Triaxilating Extendable Shields
description: Shield emitters have struggled to maintain the coherence of medium range graviton beams. The higher the graviton density of the beam, the sooner it dissipates. If the emitters were refit with a triaxilating graviton beam behaving in a similar way to other triaxilating energy patterns, it should gain a more stable cohesion, increasing the rate that nearby ships shields can be reinforced at.

name: Nano-Shield Capacitors
description: The miniaturisation of ultra-high discharge rate shield capacitors has reached the nanoscale which can be embedded in the hull material. Capacitor material availability, and the time required to embed it in a host material, serve to limit the amount that can be installed per starship. Despite this, a significant gain in combat shield regeneration rates is expected.

name: Vulcan Gravimetric Sensor Techniques
description: Gravimetric logic banks cross check and discard illogical data sets allowing for improved sensor output.

name: Tellarite Force Field Techniques
description: Strong force field technology ensures the integrity of Tellarite vessels when arguments break out.

name: Zero Point Storage
description: A vacuum is not truly empty, but rather a collection of zero-point states. This may be usable in regards to collecting, storing and acting upon assorted electromagnetic particles.

name: Tetryonic Power
description: A Tetryon is a type of subatomic particle that originates from subspace. By extruding the particle field through different subspace manifolds in a controlled manner, it is possible to extract energy from the shallower subspace strata without the dangers of tetryonic radiation.

name: Advanced Fissionable Interactions
description: A design that uses fast neutrons to sustain a fission reaction and consumes Pergium, a radioactive element rich in fissionable materials that produces less radiotoxic nuclear waste and doesn't require a neutron moderator. This type of reactor uses helium as coolant, material readily available near Class I type Gas Giants.

name: Secondary Deflector Array
description: With the addition of Secondary Deflector Arrays, our ships are now able to detect and deflect particles at a much further distance than was previously possible. This enables ships to travel more quickly while at warp.

name: Neuro-Electric Field Generator
description: Most species lack detailed knowledge of how their brains work. But we are Borg, we have not only extensively studied the brains of countless species, we have brought them closer to perfection. They can be enhanced further by linking their lower functions, forming a neuro-electric field. Healthy drones will help injured drones by superimposing the correct functioning of the damaged parts onto them.

name: Fluidic Rift Generator
description: Utilising the unique properties of Fluidic Space and the technology salvaged from discovered wreckage, this technology forces a breach in the space barrier.

name: Advanced Fluidic Rift Generator
description: This technology allows for a more stable breach to be formed to allow more controlled access between Fluidic Space and other realms.

name: Dervish Device
description: It seems that a calm mind conquers all. With some adaptation inspired by religious symbolism to the weapon consoles onboard our ships, we can increase their effectiveness. Furthermore phased hand weapons out an airlock can increase our damage output by 20%.

name: Secondary Plasmadyne Relay
description: The Plasmadyne Relay is a component of a starship's warp drive systems, capable of improving quantum efficiency. To protect the converter interface from failure due to excessive warp field stress, a secondary inverter may be required.

name: EPS Manifold
description: Linking the EPS manifolds directly into our weapon systems allows the rapid transfer of power to weapon systems that require it.

name: Phase Interlocker Customisation
description: Customisable interlocks can be used to shunt warp plasma to different systems rapidly, resulting in improved energy where it is needed.

name: Shield Damage Specialisation
description: Improvements to our weaponry allows for improved damage to an enemy vessels shields.

name: Armor Damage Specialisation
description: Improvements to our weaponry allows for improved damage to an enemy vessels armour.

name: Hull Damage Specialisation
description: Improvements to our weaponry allows for improved damage to an enemy vessels hull.

name: Warp-Age Weaponry Design Breakthrough
description: Our weapons knowledge has proven fairly useless in this new era of interstellar exploration and conflict. The technological boom that warp travel wrought has given us more avenues of weapon technology to explore than we have the ability to investigate. We must merge all of our research, from prefire particle excitation chambers to exotic matter warheads, and decide which path to develop further.

name: Beam Weapons Superiority
