description: Different atomic and subatomic particles can be constricted to beams that are directed at a target. These energy beams are more effective at breaching shields and causing hull damage than conventional energy cannons. Further research will no doubt produce more effective beam weapons.

name: Cannon Weapons Superiority
description: These weapons fire intense bursts of highly energetic particles at a target. While they inflict significant amounts of damage, the particle bursts travel at slower speeds and need to be carefully aimed and aligned with their targets.

name: Explosive Weapons Superiority
description: These weapons release huge amounts of energy in the area of impact. They are very effective at draining shields and causing general damage, but not very effective at tactical strikes. Further research would no doubt improve the abilities of these weapons.

name: Warp-Age Weapon Miniaturisation
description: Specialising in weaponry allows for unique properties on our weapons. This branch focuses on miniaturising our weaponry.

name: Light Weapons Specialisation
description: Specialising in weaponry allows for unique properties on our weapons. This branch focuses on improving light weaponry.

name: Medium Weapons Specialisation
description: Specialising in weaponry allows for unique properties on our weapons. This branch focuses on improving medium weaponry.

name: Heavy Weapons Specialisation
description: Specialising in weaponry allows for unique properties on our weapons. This branch focuses on improving heavy weaponry.

name: Warp-Age Weapon Research and Design
description: The vast interstellar distances and speeds that warp age combat can occur over require an entirely new design of research and weapons.

name: Anti-Armour Weapons Specialisation
description: Specialising in weaponry allows for unique properties on our weapons. This branch focuses on adapting weaponry in order to damage armour.

name: Anti-Shield Weapons Specialisation
description: Specialising in weaponry allows for unique properties on our weapons. This branch focuses on adapting weaponry in order to damage shields.

name: Artillery Weapons Specialisation
description: Specialising in weaponry allows for unique properties on our weapons. This branch focuses on adapting artillery weaponry to be more destructive.

name: Anti-Hull Weapons Specialisation
description: Specialising in weaponry allows for unique properties on our weapons. This branch focuses on adapting weaponry in order to damage hulls.

name: Point Defense Weapons Specialisation
description: Specialising in weaponry allows for unique properties on our weapons. This branch focuses on adapting weaponry in order to improve point defence.

name: Secondary Tactical Node
description: A secondary tactical node allows for secondary tasks such as command and control, or tactical system scanning to be achieved without reducing the effectiveness of the primary consoles.

name: High-Focusing Time-Crystal Array
description: This targeting array utilises time-crystals in order to enable precision targeting. Whilst normal crystals repeat their pattern in space but remain unchanged in time, time-crystals repeat themselves in time too, enabling us to utilise the crystals to target objects at optimal locations in time. In effect, we can see where they are the instant they arrive - with no effect from time dilation.

name: Medevlan Gauss Cannon
description: Researched by a hermit scientist named Medevlan. Gauss cannons are crude but effective weapons. The old hermit seems to have figured out how to create a control system for the simple but complex device.

name: Isokinetic Cannon
description: A directed energy cannon is now being developed. It seems by utilising various polarising fields we can create particles that almost completely bypass shielding. These particles will be brought to impact the enemy target.

name: Muon Cannon
description: Muons are short-lived subatomic particles similar to electrons, but some two hundred times heavier. Due to these two facts these weapons are extremely destructive but are only effective at relatively short range.

name: Quantum Resonance Cannon
description: These weapons resonate at such high frequencies at quantum level and with such intensity, that shields are virtually useless against them. Thus, they make for very effective shield draining weapons.

name: Guardian Laser
description: Advances in laser weaponry allow for the potential of constructing lightspeed laser weapons known as Guardian lasers.

name: Optronic Pulse Array
description: An optronic weapons array is a type of advanced weapon system that fires optronic pulses; however, careful cooling is required.

name: Boolean Cannon
description: Almost unheard-of amounts of power can be pushed into a single weapon mount, creating a blast capable of destroying ships outright.

name: Quantum Plasmadyne Relay
description: The plasmadyne relay is a component of a starship's warp drive systems, capable of improving quantum efficiency.

name: Inverted Plasmadyne Relay
description: The plasmadyne relay is a component of a starship's warp drive systems, capable of improving quantum efficiency. By inverting the phase of the warp plasma, further improvements can be made.

name: Atomic Disruption Field
description: Breaking down the bonds of atoms within a vessels hull is a surefire way to ensure maximum armour damage.

name: Subatomic Disruptor Field
description: Breaking down the subatomic bonds of atoms within a vessels hull is a surefire way to ensure maximum damage.

name: FTL Scattershot Pattern
description: Scattering a field at faster than light speeds across a region can result in a massive spread of damage.

name: Subspace Scattershot Pattern
description: Scattering a field across subspace in a region can result in massively broad pattern, resulting in damage to ships even in warp.

name: Focusing Arrays
description: Perfecting the firing cadence of laser weaponry is a task that could keep the Engineering elite of any given planet busy for centuries.

name: Flash Coolant
description: New developments in tech cooling regularly surface, improving the stability and efficiency of our weapons systems, keeping them from blowing up the ships upon which they are mounted.

name: Teratogenic Coolant
description: This extremely efficient heat conducting gas allows for the usage of higher poweredwarp drives which further expand our ship capabilities.

name: Central Priming Mechanism
description: Development in the priming mechanism of explosive weapons has lead tofurther automation in the priming of warheads, leading to fasterlaunching of weapons.

name: Miniaturized Pre-Igniters
description: Advances in miniaturisation allow for more rapid loading and discharging of torpedo payloads.

name: Thermodynamic Yield Control
description: With the warhead explosive reaction tightly controlled by missile-board microprocessors, warhead detonations can be tuned for maximum effect for local conditions at the time of impact.

name: Aceton Assimilator
description: These ancient yet ingenious devices sap energy from ship systems and, during the Promellian Menthar wars, also converted the energy to radiation, proving fatal to ship crews. We have adjusted these generators to simply drain shields.

name: Dual-Intermix Chamber
description: By adding an additional intermix chamber to our weapons, we can increase the amount of damage and rate of fire of our weaponry.

name: High-Energy Collimator
description: Adding a high-energy collimator to produce numerous parallel beams that coalesce with the main beam increases the damage of our beam weaponry.

name: Miniaturised Aceton Assimilator
description: Improved power and plasma functions allow for the components of an aceton assimilator to be miniaturised, whilst simultaneously improving performance.

name: Comatiser Mk. II Assimilator
description: Comatising the pulse arrays and inverting plasma functions allows for a large area effect that disrupts the power and regeneration of the shields of enemy ships.

name: Energy Dissipator
description: A device that dampens energy use. As a weapon this will greatly reduce a ship or stations energy output, starving their systems of much needed energy.

name: Advanced Energy Dissipator
description: Our energy dissipators can be improved with new targeting data, allowing them to drain further amounts of power from a ship or stations energy output, reducing the power of their weapons.

name: Intermix-Dampening Enhanced Dissipator
description: Our enhanced dissipator further disrupts and dampens the formation of energy within foreign intermix chambers, reducing the power of enemy weapons

name: Hyper-Spatial Mk. 3 Dissipator
description: Our hyper-spatial dissipator forms subspace anomalies that drain and dampen the formation of energy within foreign intermix chambers, reducing the power of enemy weapons.

name: Exographic Targeting Sensor
description: The exographic targeting sensor can target objects that are hidden behind opaque barriers, such as shielding leading to increased penetration.

name: Integrated Targeting Sensor
description: By scanning enemy starships using the electromagnetic spectrum, we are able to find minute weaknesses in their shields and armour. After merging this technology with our targeting sensors, the effectiveness of our weapons has been greatly increased.

name: Warp Plasma Infused EPS Relay
description: The EPS relays and conduits are infused with plasma from the warp core, allowing for larger power usage during battle.

name: Secondary Tactical Node
description: A secondary coprocessing tactical node allows for non-critical calculations to be performed whilst not interfering with main systems.

name: Pulse Cannons
description: Basic plasma-based pulse cannons. Due to the importance of mastering plasma for building warp-capable starships, these are often one of the first viable directed-energy weapons a civilisation will develop. Although able to break up asteroids and meteors, their low range and yield hinders their effectiveness against starship armour and shields. Wise users seek an upgrade at the first opportunity.

name: Phase Weaponry
description: Phase weapons, like phasers, use destructive nadion beams. However, creating a 'pure' nadion emitter is a significant scientific and engineering challenge. The 'impure' emitters of phase weapons still offer a significant boost over pulse cannons, despite the particle beam being polluted with inert particles.

name: Phase-Modulated Particle Weaponry
description: Modulating a phase cannon's particle beam allows some non-nadion particles to be filtered out. With 'pure' nadion emitters entering testing, it won't be long before phase cannons are replaced with true phasers.

name: Burst Phaser
description: Mixing the phaser coils with small amounts of prefiring plasma allows for bursts of potent phase energy. Further work is required on the stability of the plasma and mixing of the phased energy.

name: Burst Phaser Mk. II
description: Improvements to the storage chambers for the phased plasma allow for the plasma to be kept at a less stable, but more potent, intermix ratio, resulting in a larger destructive impact.

name: Burst Phaser Mk. III
description: Rotating intermix chambers allow for the unstable plasma to be passed from chamber to chamber and kept at a very high energy state which, when released, results in a burst of phased plasma energy with devastating impact.

name: Phaser Cannon
description: This cannon functions similarly to a standard Phaser, but without a continuous beam. Energy emissions are instead stored in a magnetic field, allowing them to coalesce and agitate to higher energy states. The field is then redirected, forcing the energy burst toward the target. This is repeated rapidly using multiple magnetic field generators, resulting in a stream of phased energy projectiles.

name: Next Generation Phaser Tech
description: With every generation scientists make breakthroughs in technology, making improvements in everything from Warp to weapons. Scientists have made a major breakthrough in Phaser technology which will allow for the creation of more powerful and effective phaser based technology.

name: Phaser Lance
description: Technology has advanced enough to finally put some of the more outlandish designs into operation. One of which is an extra-large spinal-mounted phaser emitter, capable of launching a powerful phaser blast able to penetrate through entire ships.

name: Optronically Targeted Phaser
description: The development of more complex optronic targeting sensors had previously stalled due to the increased maintenance requirements, for little gain. Phaser cannons fire powerful but relatively slow travelling shots. Contemporary targeting sensors are designed for near-light speed particle beams or torpedoes. Their incompatibility with phaser cannons necessitates that we resume their development.

name: Co-Efficient Phasers
description: Accurate and reasonably powerful nadion particle beams. While most phasers appear yellow or orange, the higher frequencies used by Andorian phaser nadion emitters cause a stylishly blue output.

name: Advanced Co-Efficient Phasers
description: Improvements to our power supply and storage devices allow for incremental improvements to our phaser technology as well. By utilising Andorian flux capacitors within our primary phaser coils, we can adjust the phaser beam coefficients easily, from a low-powered setting to a high-powered, searing blue beam.

name: Co-Efficient Phaser Pulse
description: Improvements to our power supply and storage devices allow for incremental improvements to our phaser technology as well. By utilising flux capacitors within our primary phaser coils, we can adjust the phaser beam coefficients easily, from a low-powered setting to a high-powered searing pulse of blue energy.

name: Co-Efficient Dual-Bank Phaser
description: Improvements to our power supply and storage devices allow for incremental improvements to our phaser technology as well. By utilising flux capacitors within our primary phaser coils, we can adjust the phaser beam coefficients easily, from a low-powered setting to a high-powered, searing blue dual beam bank.

name: Co-Efficient Phaser Array
description: Improvements to our power supply and storage devices allow for incremental improvements to our phaser technology as well. By utilising flux capacitors within our primary phaser coils, we can adjust the phaser beam coefficients easily, from a low-powered setting to a high-powered blue beam array.

name: Co-Efficient Phaser Matrix
description: The creation of a matrix allows for the adjustment of phaser beam coefficients rapidly and without the requirement for flux capacitors.

name: Particle Phasers
description: A hybrid nadion/heavy particle beam that works to weaken and smash apart the atomic structure of the target. The increased engineering complexity over a nadion-only phaser makes this a rarer, albeit potentially more potent, design.

name: Nadion Coherent Particle-Weaponry
description: Nadions weaken the nuclear forces between atoms, allowing for our particle weaponry to more easily tear the bonds apart.

name: Plasma-Phaser Technology
description: Phasers and plasma weapons work on different principles. Attempting to combine the destructive mechanisms of both technologies may yield an increase in weapon effectiveness.

name: Nadion-Enriched Plasma Weaponry
description: Continued plasma-phaser hybrid weapon research bears fruit. Nadions weaken the nuclear forces between the targets atoms, making it easier for the energy imparted by the plasma to rip them apart.

name: Compressed Phased Plasma Beam
description: Using the overflowing plasma from the warp drives plasma injectors we can augment our phasers with plasma allowing them to hold more charge and hit harder.

name: Multiphased Plasma Beam
description: Using phase modulators plugged directly into the plasma chamber will allow stronger, more stable plasma beams that can adjust their phase to compensate for efforts to counter them. With several cooling modules allowing for a faster cool off, continuous streams could be achieved.

name: Wave Disruptors
description: Unique type of phaser which seeks to maximise destructive efficiency and minimise wear on the nadion emitter. The phaser beam oscillates slightly, aiming to introduce a disruptive interference pattern in the strong and weak nuclear forces between two locations. When successful, a larger area loses atomic cohesion than would be possible with a standard phaser.

name: Advanced Compression Beam Weaponry
description: Improvements to compression beam technology allow for the miniaturisation of the compression fields, resulting in more portable, more effective compression beam weaponry. Able to be utilised inside dampening fields and at close range, the compressed beam bursts out multiple volleys of energy for maximum damage.

name: Spiral-Wave Disruptor
description: Combining the initial efforts in disruptor technology with phased variances and intermittent power spikes have put us on a path towards the spiral wave disruptor, a powerful weapon in the right hands.

name: Spiral-Wave Disruptor Miniaturisation
description: Improvements to the manufacturing process and refining of cooling techniques should allow for miniaturisation of our disruptors.

name: Spiral Cresting-Wave Disruptor
description: Laboratory experiments have shown that plying the disruptor beam with phased energy transfers allows for waves that encourage the creation of a 'Cresting-Wave' type function within the weapon.

name: Spiral Quantum Cresting-Wave Disruptor
description: Plying the disruptor beam with subatomic neutronic particles will increase the potential of our weaponry

name: Phasers
description: Phasers fire nadions, an artificially created particle, at their target. Nadion particles interfere with the nuclear forces that bind atoms together. Unusually versatile, nadion beams can be adapted for many uses such as heating, drilling, stunning, killing, disintegrating, and more.

name: Nadion Spinner
description: Advances in miniaturized, rapid cycling plasma based synchrotrons can be weaponised. Colloquially known as 'spinners', these devices use 'raw' EPS plasma to accelerate groups of nadions to high energies almost instantaneously. An array of 'spinners' can be coordinated to fire their nadion pulses in sequence, achieving a higher energy output.

name: Reinforced Nadion Spinner
description: Phasers and disruptors produce nadions when they are fired. A nadion is an artificially-generated particle capable of liberating atomic nuclei, disrupting nuclear forces. By researching ways to utilise this byproduct, we could improve out weapon technology substantially.

name: Phaser Technology Principles
description: Phase weapons, or phase-modulated energy weapons, are a type of directed-energy particle weapon that utilized a phase modulator to control the blast yield.

name: Phaser Coil
description: Advances in nadion particle physics have lead to new ways of interacting with them. Phaser coils allow for the modulation of a phasers frequency and power without the bulky, power hungry equipment previously used, such as 'spinners'. Aside from increased efficiency, new variations and specialisations of phasers can now be experimented with.

name: Dedicated Oscillating Phaser Weaponry
description: The phaser beam can be modulated to oscillate slightly, aiming to introduce a disruptive interference pattern in the strong and weak nuclear forces between two locations. When successful, a larger area loses atomic cohesion than would be possible with a standard phaser.

name: Co-Variant Pulse
description: A covariant phaser pulse is a theorised, specialised directed-energy discharge capable of taking advantage of phase retractions, an energy phenomenon which can occur when power is transferred from one system to another in an enemy vessel shield configuration.

name: Phaser Emitter
description: Early versions of the phaser turret have been promising. The addition of more capacitors to the pre-fire circuits will lengthen the amount of time the turret fires for before having to recharge.

name: Regenerative Phaser Weaponry
description: Due to the phaser turrets burst fire pattern, the nadion emitters operate inefficiently. Some of the waste energy can be recovered and used to keep the emitters semi-charged between phaser pulses.

name: Quad-Interlinked Phaser Blaster
description: Phaser turrets use highly agile gimbal mounts to stop recoil affecting their aim, which lock into place when firing. This reduces their ability to track a target. If four phaser emitters in shock mounts are fixed to each turret and linked to the same targeting sensor, the turret can deal with the recoil without locking the gimbal.

name: Assault phaser
description: The premise of the assault phaser is simple. Shunt as much power as possible through the nadion emitter, without triggering a cascading pion decomposition of the nadion forming sub-strata. The resulting particle beam is potent, but also lacks cohesion. This limits its effectiveness against shields.

name: Compressed Phase Disruptor
description: Nadion Emitters allow for a wide range of particle beam frequencies and energy levels and work best when powered with a high frequency energy source. This disrupts the first phase of a pion cascade and prevents it harmonising, preserving the nadion forming sub-strata for longer. The result creates a higher power particle beam with the loss of being able to generate low power beams.

name: Pulse Compression Wave Phaser
description: Most phasers fire a continuous beam of nadion particles. Studies of how assault phaser beams act when impacting a target have revealed that a pulsed beam might be more effective. Sadly, no nadion emitters capable of generating pulses at a high enough energy have been developed. Instead, the phaser coil assembly will have to be augmented with a low power graviton generator.

name: Hull-Breacher Phasers
description: The success of assault phasers against hull material has led to the formal declaration of the 'Hull-Breacher' classification of phaser. Weapon specifications, manufacturing plans, logistical chains, maintenance guides, combat doctrine training manuals, and more are required to use this effectively and to lay the foundation for their future development and incorporation into new starship designs.

name: Auto-Phaser Interlock
description: Initially conceived by accident, the auto-phaser interlock is a byproduct of phaser technology. By configuring the beams together and activating the interlock, the ship's main deflector can release a powerful beam of energy.

name: Co-Variant Reinforced Phaser
description: A covariant phaser pulse is a theorised, specialised directed-energy discharge capable of taking advantage of phase retractions, an energy phenomenon which can occur when power is transferred from one system to another in an enemy vessel's shield configuration.

name: Plasma Phaser
description: Phasers and plasma weapons work on different principles. Attempting to combine the destructive mechanisms of both technologies may yield an increase in weapon effectiveness.

name: Mounted Heavy Phaser
description: Starbase weaponry allows for heavy phaser mounts to be built directly into the superstructure and power grid, allowing for long-range powerful weaponry.

name: Mounted Oscillating Phaser
description: The phaser beam can be modulated to oscillate slightly, aiming to introduce a disruptive interference pattern in the strong and weak nuclear forces between two locations. When successful, a larger area loses atomic cohesion than would be possible with a standard phaser.

name: Mounted Co-Variant Phaser
description: A starbase-mounted covariant phaser pulse is a theorised, specialised directed-energy discharge capable of taking advantage of phase retractions, an energy phenomenon which can occur when power is transferred from one system to another in an enemy vessel shield configuration.

name: Atalskes Phase Handheld Weaponry
description: Atalskes Phased Energy Beam Weapons offer the latest in small arms weaponry. This will give our ground forces a significant boost to offensive capabilities.

name: Phaser-Disruptor Handheld Weaponry
description: Advances in small arms weaponry have led to the development of hand held beam weapons. These will give our ground forces a distinct advantage.

name: Phaser Weaponry Breakthrough
description: The invention of the phaser coil has driven a revolution in phaser engineering. As a result, independent research teams have created a few theoretically sound specifications for new types of phasers. Due to the highly specialised equipment that would need to be developed in order to apply each theory, we can only pursue one idea.

name: Modulated Phaser Weaponry
description: Phaser coils can be used to control the modulation of a phaser beam. The increased speed and control over beam modulation should allow the phaser to closely match the modulation of the target's shield, partially bypassing the shield and damaging the hull. Mounting the phaser in higher precision gimbals should increase its accuracy enough to allow for subsystem targeting.

name: Tunneling Phaser Weaponry
description: Tunneling phasers appear to fire a single phaser beam, but it is actually a composite of several small beams. Precise convergence of these beams concentrates their energy into a smaller area, boring through thick armour with ease. Difficulty in beam convergence at distance reduces their maximum effective range.

name: Multiphased Phaser Weaponry
description: Each phaser can be assigned a unique set of frequencies, which they will rotate at random throughout the firing cycle. The resulting multiphasic phaser beam will be hard, or even impossible, for a shield to fully block.

name: Graviton-Phaser Weaponry
description: Shields are formed from layers of gravitons enveloping the target. It's been suggested that if we infuse our phaser beams with gravitons, then micro disturbances will occur at the shield impact site. These disturbances should bend the shield and shift its frequency, rendering it ineffective. First, we must discover a way of achieving this without causing the beam to distort and harmlessly scatter.

name: Modulated Phaser Bank
description: Our prototype modulated phaser emitters have been spread across our starship's hulls. While this gives a good range of firing arcs for the number of emitters, it limits their effective power. Grouping our emitters into a smaller number of banks will concentrate their firepower, increasing combat effectiveness. Modulated phasers remain effective at penetrating all known shield designs.

name: Tunneling Phaser Bank
description: Our tunneling phaser emitters have been used in low numbers, spread across our hulls. While this gives a good range of firing arcs for the number of emitters, it limits their effective power. Grouping our emitters into a smaller number of banks will concentrate their firepower. Mounting existing tunneling phaser emitters across a flexible strip mount allows them to be focused on the same point.

name: Multiphased Phaser Bank
description: Multiphased phaser emitters have been spread across our starship's hulls. While this gives a good range of firing arcs for the number of emitters, it limits their effective power. Grouping our emitters into a smaller number of banks will concentrate their firepower. The new weapons will keep ahead of multiphasic shields by presenting too many simultaneous modulations for the shield to block.

name: Graviton-Phaser Bank
description: Graviton phaser emitters have been spread across our starship's hulls. While this gives a good range of firing arcs for the number of emitters, it limits their effective power. Grouping our emitters into a smaller number of banks will concentrate their firepower. Modern graviton emitters are smaller and more powerful, meaning more space for the phasers' nadion emitters.

name: Modulated Phaser Array
description: Phasers have traditionally been arranged into banks of a small number of phaser emitters. Phaser arrays contain a larger number of emitters, providing a direct firepower increase. Some configurations allow energy to be channelled along strips so that more emitters may be used. These arrays will increase the speed at which our phasers remodulate, keeping pace with advances in adaptive shields.

name: Tunneling Phaser Array
description: Phasers have traditionally been arranged into banks of a small number of phaser emitters. Phaser arrays contain a much a larger number of emitters, providing a direct firepower increase. Some configurations allow energy to be channelled along phaser strips so that more emitters may be used against a target. These arrays can easily act as up-scaled tunnelling phasers.

name: Multiphased Phaser Array
description: Phasers have traditionally been arranged into banks of a small number of phaser emitters. Phaser arrays contain a much a larger number of emitters, providing a direct firepower increase. The design of an array limits the use of previously developed enhanced modulation emitters, so a new method of remodulating the phaser will need to be developed.

name: Graviton-Phaser Array
description: The infusion of gravitons within the phaser beams can create micro gravitic disturbances at the impact location, which bends and shifts the resultant defensive frequency of the target vessels shields allowing for our phasers to pass unhindered.

name: Modulated Phaser Rotating-Freq Matrix
description: If each separate emitter is assigned a unique set of frequencies which they rotate at random, the resulting phaser beam frequency will constantly shift. This will keep us ahead of advances in remodulating shield technology. With additional computational capacity in the fire control subsystems, the frequency shift can be used to maintain the modulated phasers shield-penetrating ability.

name: Tunneling Phaser Rotating-Freq Matrix
description: We can now experiment with creating a tunneling beam matrix. Cavities lined with a complex, honeycomb-like arrangement of phaser emitters are embedded along the hull without reducing its integrity. Due to the high density of phasers per matrix cavity, each emitter must be phase shifted relative to the other emitters in that cavity.

name: Multiphase Phaser Rotating-Freq Matrix
description: We can now experiment with creating a multiphased beam matrix. Cavities lined with a complex, honeycomb-like arrangement of phaser emitters are embedded along the hull without reducing its integrity. These phaser beams will be composed of hundreds of microbeams, each with a unique phase and modulation, overwhelming defensive shields.

name: Graviton-Phaser Rotating-Freq Matrix
description: This technology amplifies phaser energy by manipulating gravitational forces with rotating frequencies, enhancing beam potency, and extending range. It underscores the cutting-edge innovation in physics, augmenting combat capabilities and pushing the boundaries of energy manipulation and plasma dynamics.

name: Adaptive Regenerative Phaser Grid
description: This boosts phaser efficiency through adaptive resonance frequency and energy modulation. This technology enhances phaser self-repair capabilities, sustains combat operations, and dynamically adjusts output frequencies for optimal performance against diverse shielding configurations. The result is increased damage output and reduced recharge rates.

name: Modulated Regenerative Phaser Grid
description: We can now experiment with creating a Modulated Regenerative phased grid. Cavities lined with a complex, honeycomb-like arrangement of phaser emitters are embedded along the hull without reducing its integrity. These phaser beams will be composed of hundreds of microbeams, each with a unique phase and modulation, overwhelming defensive shields.

name: Multiphase Regenerative Phaser Grid
description: We can now experiment with creating a multiphased beam matrix. Cavities lined with a complex, honeycomb-like arrangement of phaser emitters are embedded along the hull without reducing its integrity. These phaser beams will be composed of hundreds of microbeams, each with a unique phase and modulation, overwhelming defensive shields.

name: Graviton-Phaser Regenerative Grid
description: This pioneering technology harnesses the regenerative capabilities of phaser systems, employing gravitational forces to enhance grid resilience. It amplifies the phaser's regenerative properties, boosting its operational longevity and robustness through advanced energy manipulation.

name: Co-Variant Phaser Blaster
description: Initially conceived by accident, the auto-phaser interlock is a byproduct of phaser technology. By configuring the beams together and activating the interlock, the ship's main deflector can release a powerful beam of energy.

name: Compression Phaser Rifles
description: This is the handheld version of the Type IV phaser. It has been enhanced in that it has the ability to take out groups of enemies using a wide-beam setting and being able to function inside a dampening field, unlike previous models. This will definitely be a welcome addition to any armory and weapons' locker.

name: Phaser-Mount Automated Defence Systems
description: Mounting phaser weapons on towers around settlements, grants us automated defenses against anybody not granted access to the settlement. Enemy troops will take some serious damage from these.

name: Mobile Heavy-Duty Phaser Artillery
description: Capacitor technology increases and miniaturisation allow for the reduction of ship mounted phaser cannons to a mobile, ground suitable device. Firing small phaser bursts in a rotating gatling configuration results in low cooling requirements and heavy damage potential.

name: Spinal-Mount Quantum Disruptor
description: A large spinal mount allows for almost unheard of amounts of power to be pushed into a single weapon mount, creating a blast capable of destroying ships outright.

name: Tetryonic Disruptors
description: Powerful disruptors which use tetryons to rip apart the atomic structure of the target. The discovery of tetryons, a subatomic particle that is only stable in subspace, is a recent occurrence. We anticipate that further investigation will lead us to designs for more potent designs.

name: Tetryonic Pulse Disruptor
description: By utilising a particle found native to subspace, tetryons, in our disruptors, we can use their highly energetic and unstable nature to increase the damage of our disruptors.

name: Space-Fitted Blas Assault Disruptor
description: Although all current disruptors are linked to the primary tactical console, they are individually controlled by the weapons officer. Early attempts at creating a competent fire control AI have failed, because it never consistently outperformed the weapons officer. Some have suggested that we develop a system to assist the weapons officer and boost their performance under stress.

name: Bach'Hich Assault Disruptor
description: Running massive amounts of power through the plasma arrays onboard the ship allows for a new ship weapon very similar to our Bach'Hich ground assault weapons. Whilst heavily energy intensive, these disruptors can disintegrate targets rapidly.

name: Gravimetric Disruptor
description: Rather than use space time or simple plasma impact, a disruptor using gravimetric energy as the main emitter will use the force of gravity to destroy the target.

name: Gravimetric Disruptor Battery
description: Rather than use space-time or simple plasma impact, a disruptor battery using gravimetric energy as the main emitter will use the force of gravity to destroy the target.

name: Crescent-Wave Disruptor Technology
description: A line shaped disruptor can create a new effect. By creating a line of impacts, a wave is created, resulting in a hull breach 90% of the time.

name: Plasma Disruptor
description: With the introduction of exotic particles into the disruptor generator matrix we might be able to develop an improved impact reaction from our disruptors. These disruptors should take over some of the plasma weapon traits like plasma's intense heat potential.

name: Modulated Plasma Beam
description: Using several plasma modules plugged into the plasma chamber, will allow stronger more stable plasma beams. With the several modules allowing a faster cool off, continuous streams could be achieved.

name: Positronic Disruptors
description: Research into weaponising positrons, particles with the same mass as an electron but with a positive charge, have initially resulting in a weapon that fires a blast of positronic radiation that disrupts systems and atomic bonds, causing damage to the surrounding area.

name: Hyperonic Radiation Disruptors
description: An explosion at a power plant which emitted mass amounts of radiation has given our researchers some ideas into adjusting disruptor frequencies to emit hyperonic radiation, lethal to most humanoids.

name: Biogenic Radiation Disruptors
description: A further upgrade to our radiation disruptors is the creation of a biogenic radiation field that will leave a hull mostly intact but target its crew and terminate their life signs.

name: Quantum Carrier-Wave Weaponry
description: By guiding particles along a carrier-wave, they might become broken down to their quantum parts. Bombarding shields with these waves will drain their power as the parts of the atoms carry energy into the subatomic realm and subspace.

name: Thalaron Weapons
description: Thalaron Weapons employ Thalaron radiation, a type of radiation in the tertiary EM band with biogenic properties, able to consume organic matter at the subatomic level. It is even more deadly since even a small amount would expand at a dangerous rate. One way these weapons could be utilised is a cascading biogenic pulse.

name: Thalaron Blaster
description: Thalaron Weapons are weapons that employ Thalaron radiation, a type of radiation in the tertiary EM band with biogenic properties, able to consume organic matter at the subatomic level. It is even more deadly as even a small amount would expand at a dangerous rate. One way these weapons could be utilised is a cascading biogenic pulse.

name: Disruptor Cannon
description: Disruptor cannons rapidly fire weak energy discharges to vaporize their target. Although they lack accuracy, the low energy of each shot reduces the damage lost with a miss. This means that they have a higher potential damage output than some of the more accurate weapon systems.

name: Phase Disruptors
description: Using energy pulses in combination with a disruptor guiding systems, we might be able to develop a disruptor with a phased output. It will will be costly but far more effective.

name: Enhanced Phase Disruptors
description: Utilising energy pulses in combination with disruptor guiding systems, we may be able to develop an enhanced disruptor with a variable phased output.

name: Disruptor Technology Principles
description: The basic principles of disruptor technology is that disruptors cause damage by exciting the molecular bonds of targets to such great extents that those bonds are weakened, and/or broken, by the energies emitted, which often manifest as explosive force

name: Hadron Collimator
description: Hadrons can be used to range find and adjust the energy requirements for turrets; however, in order to proceed parallel to the energy beam, a specialised collimator is required.

name: Composite Hadron Collider
description: Combining the hadron rangefinder with a composite dish allows for improved long-range engagement and tracking.

name: Artificial Hadron Generator
description: The power requirements and technology to create our own hadrons at will allows for improved long-range engagement and tracking.

name: Disruptor Barbette
description: Disruptor turrets are attached to the outside of a ships hull. Lacking armour, they rely on being small enough so that hostile vessels can not maintain an accurate weapons lock. Changing to relying on armoured barbettes will allow larger models of disruptors to be fitted.

name: Disruptor Gatling
description: Disruptor weaponry often causes damage during prolonged battles through overheating. Utilising ancient Gatling technology, we can rotate the barrels, ensuring a rapid delivery of weapon fire but ensuring no damage to ourselves.

name: Disruptor Autocannon Grid
description: In order to increase the damage of our cannons, it is possible that firing numerous, smaller bursts of disruptors in larger amounts can cause more damage. Capacitor technology increases allow for more charge per volley and multiple emitters in a grid array.

name: Phase-Resonance Disruptors
description: The first models of the phase disruptor have proven their worth in the field. Fitting the firing chamber with a high energy tolerant phase discriminator, coupled to a phase modulator, will enable the fire control computer to create a sympathetic resonance in the disruptor pulse. The resonance will increase the disruptive effect on the target more than simply boosting the pulse energy would.

name: Harmonics Disruptor
description: Improvements to manufacturing have allowed for the fitting of a firing chamber with an extremely high energy tolerant phase discriminator, coupled to a resonating phase modulator. The modulator can find the optimum resonance of the hull to cause maximum disruption and damage, enabling the fire control computer to create a sympathetic resonance in the disruptor pulse that disrupts a target.

name: Photonic Disruptor
description: We can attack the atomic structure of the targets hull to weaken its molecular bonds by exploiting the photoelectric effect. Infusing our disruptor bolts with large amounts of photons modulated to the correct frequency for the targets hull composition will be difficult to achieve, but worth the effort.

name: Assault Disruptor
description: The assault disruptor is similar to previous disruptors but with one key change. The energy emissions are stored in a magnetic field, allowing them to coalesce and agitate to higher energy states. When redirected, this forces the burst of energy toward the target. This process is repeated using multiple magnetic field generators, resulting in a stream of heavily damaging disruptor projectiles.

name: Focused System-5 Disruptor
description: With the energy emissions stored in a magnetic field, allowing them to coalesce and agitate to higher energy states, the bursts of energy produced from this system are extremely powerful. This process is repeated rapidly using multiple magnetic field generators, and the result is a stream of heavily damaging disruptor projectiles.

name: Subatomic Disruptor
description: Improvements to manufacturing and tolerances have allowed for the fitting of a firing chamber with a very-high-energy-tolerant phase discriminator, coupled to a phase modulator. This enables the fire control computer to create a sympathetic resonance in the disruptor pulse that disrupts a target at a subatomic level.

name: Subatomic System-6 Disruptor
description: With the energy emissions stored in a magnetic field, allowing them to coalesce and agitate to higher energy states, the bursts of energy produced from this system are extremely powerful. The addition of a phase discriminator allows for a sympathetic resonance that allows disruptor pulses to disrupt their target on a subatomic level.

name: Platform-Mounted Heavy Disruptor
description: Plasma disruptors are good weapons, but creating a specialised mounted version of them should bring new benefits. A concentrated plasma disruptor pulse is theorised to be able to punch a several centimetre wide hole in shields. Some plasma should damage the armour and bleed through to the hull. Adapting unused, compact cannon designs is the logical choice for implementing this kind of weapon.

name: Mounted Resonance Disruptor
description: Fitting the firing chamber with a high-energy-tolerant phase discriminator, coupled to a phase modulator, will enable the fire control computer to create a sympathetic resonance in the disruptor pulse. The resonance will increase the disruptive effect on the target more than simply boosting the pulse energy.

name: Mounted Subatomic Disruptor
description: Improvements to manufacturing have allowed for the fitting of a firing chamber with an extremely-high-energy-tolerant phase discriminator, coupled to a resonating phase modulator. The modulator can find the optimum resonance of the hull to cause maximum disruption and damage, enabling the fire control computer to create a sympathetic resonance in the disruptor pulse that disrupts a target.

name: Varon-T Disruptor
description: Varon-T disruptors work by disrupting the target's molecular bonds. This process starts deep within the target, slowly tearing them apart from the inside. Most civilisations ban this weapon due to the unnecessarily painful and drawn out death. We are not concerned with the ethics of how we dispose of our enemies, so we should learn how to mass produce this weapon and equip our troops with them.

name: CRM 114 Cryonic Rifle
description: A new shock rifle has been requested by our troops with a preference for one that will kill slowly and painfully. A rifle that fires electromagnetically-contained packets of electron-less krypton, cooled to near absolute zero, should suffice. Early prototypes can incapacitate most targets with one shot, causing unbelievably excruciating pain, followed by death one to two minutes later.

name: Disruptor Weaponry Breakthrough
description: Our primary disruptor weapons are devastatingly effective. However, those who do not innovate are doomed to stagnate and fade into history. We should begin a search of our empire's labs and sensor records to find promising new technology that we can weaponize. The search will likely consume a significant amount of resources. We'll have to carefully choose which lead to follow.

name: Tetryonic Pulse Disruptor Cannon
description: Tetryons are native to subspace, thus in normal space they become energised and unstable, giving them the potential to be weaponised, but first we must learn to deal with their unpredictable nature. The proposed weapon is a small tetryonic cannon, allowing several to be mounted per ship. The cannon's pulse lacks the collimation of a beam, reducing its range and effectiveness against shields.

name: Tetryonic Pulse Disruptor Beam
description: Tetryons are native to subspace, thus in normal space they become energised and unstable. This gives them the potential to be weaponised, but first we must learn to deal with their unpredictable nature. When pulsed at certain frequencies relative to a shield's frequency, they inflict abnormally high stress upon the shield matrix, sometimes partially penetrating the shield.

name: Plasma Disruptor Cannon
description: Plasma disruptors are good weapons, but creating a specialised version of them should bring new benefits. A concentrated plasma disruptor pulse is theorised to be able to punch a several centimetre wide hole in shields. Some plasma should bleed through to the hull and could burn through the armour. Adapting unused compact cannon designs is the logical choice for implementing this kind of weapon.

name: Plasma Disruptor Beam
description: Plasma disruptors are good general weapons, but creating a specialised version of them should bring new benefits. They can be upgraded with higher rated power converters, the extra power used to overcharge the emitters and their focusing coils. The tradeoff will be a weapon that projects beams of focused plasma that vapourise armour on contact, but the beam will lose focus, limiting its range.

name: Tetryonic Pulse Disruptor Cannon
description: Tetryons are native to subspace; thus, in normal space they become energised and unstable. When pulsed at certain frequencies relative to a shield's frequency, they inflict abnormally high stress upon the shield matrix, sometimes partially penetrating the shield. By combining it with disruptor pulses, we can create a highly damaging cannon.

name: Tetryonic Disruptor Beam Bank
description: Our prototype tetryonic disruptor beam emitters have been used across our starship's hulls. While this gives a good range of firing arcs, it limits their effective power. Grouping our emitters into a smaller number of banks will concentrate their firepower, increasing combat effectiveness. It will also allow us to more precisely penetrate the enemy ships' shields to disable critical subsystems.

name: Reinforced Plasma Disruptor Cannon
description: Our efforts on improving banks of smaller, coordinated plasma cannons have produced a weapon that can control the dispersal pattern of its energy. This versatility makes it effective against both shields and armour. Currently it is restricted to firing in short bursts, but by reinforcing the structure around the cannon mounts, we may be able to increase the fire rate, damage potential, and range.

name: Plasma Disruptor Beam Bank
description: Our prototype plasma disruptor beam emitters have been used in low numbers, spread across our starships' hulls. While this gives a good range of firing arcs, it limits their effective power. Grouping our emitters into a smaller number of banks will concentrate their firepower, increasing combat effectiveness. A secondary bonus is that the emitters can share a single set of plasma waveguides.

name: Tetryonic Type-2 Disruptor Cannon
description: Improvements to the unique hybrid of tetryons and disruptor technology have increased the complexity levels of the weapon, with resulting increases to performance. Greater understand of tetryonic reactions in subspace allows for the creation of a complex intermix chamber that enhances the containment and direction of the tetryonic disruptor bursts.

name: Tetryonic Disruptor Beam Array
description: Tetryonic beam weapons have traditionally been arranged into banks of a small number of emitters. Tetryonic disruptor arrays contain a much a larger number of emitters, providing a direct firepower increase. Some configurations allow subspace precursor particles to be channelled along emitter strips, so that more emitters may be used against a target.

name: Plasma Disruptor Type-2 Cannon
description: Improvements to the unique hybrid of plasma and disruptor technology have increased the damage levels of the weapon. A complex intermix chamber allows for the containment and direction of the plasma bursts.

name: Plasma Disruptor Beam Array
description: Plasma beam weapons have traditionally been arranged into banks of emitters. Plasma disruptor arrays contain a much a larger number of emitters, providing a direct firepower increase. Some configurations allow plasma, to be channelled along emitter strips, so that more emitters may be used against a target. A complex arrangement of powerful magnetic fields helps to contain and direct the plasma.

name: Tetryonic Type-4 Disruptor Cannon
description: Contemporary subspace scanning technology has the potential to reveal the secrets of tetryon formation at a deeper level than previously recorded. Hopefully cooler operating tetryon generators will follow. This technology will be the lynchpin of the proposed Tetryonic Type-4 Disruptor Cannon.

name: Tetryonic Disruptor Matrix
description: We can now experiment with creating tetryonic beam matrix. Cavities lined with a complex, honeycomb like arrangement of tetryon emitters are embedded along the hull without reducing its integrity. Due to the high density of tetryons per matrix cavity, each emitter must be phase shifted relative to the other emitters in that cavity.

name: Plasma Disruptor Type-4 Cannon
description: An errant material evolution algorithm stumbled upon, which is a new type of high temperature superconductor. It is nearly 10% more efficient than the current substance and will allow us to shunt more plasma to our cannons. This technology will be the lynchpin of the proposed Plasma Disruptor Type-4 Cannon.

name: Plasma Disruptor Matrix
description: The development of organic superlubricant and frictionless surfaces allow for an ultra high temperature superconductor. Plasma flows almost freely across this honeycomb like matrix, whilst the disruptor energy charges rapidly in each cell. This research project would allow for the creation of the pinnacle of plasma disruption weaponry.

name: Tetryonic Type-5 Disruptor Cannon
description: The discovery of exotic tetryon particles, unleashes a disruptive force in the universe, to devastating effect. By manipulating their unique properties, this weapon unleashes concentrated beams of destructive energy that destabilise matter at a subatomic level, rendering shielding and armour mostly obsolete.

name: Tetryonic Disruptor Grid
description: By manipulating tetryonic energy fields, a tetryonic disruptor grid employs a unique strategy: the destabilisation of matter at a subatomic level. With tetryonic resonance as its ally, the grid unleashes concentrated beams of destructive energy that challenge the resilience of shielding and armour, pushing the boundaries of defensive capabilities.

name: Plasma Disruptor Type-5 Cannon
description: This cannon utilises advanced electromagnetic fields to contain and direct superheated ionised gas, releasing a focused torrent of destructive energy upon its targets. A true marvel of technological prowess, it strikes fear into the hearts of even the most formidable foes.

name: Plasma Disruptor Grid
description: Through the strategic manipulation of electromagnetic fields, this weapon utilises superheated ionised gas, transforming it into a potent force. A true testament to the mastery of cosmic forces, it strikes fear into the hearts of all who dare stand against it, for it wields the fury of stars themselves.

name: Thalaron Launcher
description: Thalaron Weapons are weapons that employ Thalaron radiation, a type of radiation in the tertiary EM band with biogenic properties, able to consume organic matter at the subatomic level. The Launcher is able to store higher levels of this radiation before releasing it in a deadly and powerful blast.

name: Thalaron Planet Steriliser
description: Taking the Thalaron weapons one step further to use them against a Planet would be the ultimate act of aggression against another empire. However our scientists have managed to exponentially increase the weapons yield with devastating consequences.

name: Plasma Cannon
description: Cannons which fire bursts of compressed plasma. Upon impact, the plasma disrupts shields and vaporizes hull plating. While not an accurate weapon, their high rate of fire makes them effective in combat. Ships can typically mount several cannons due to their small size.

name: Modulating Plasma Pulse Cannon
description: Research into the effects of plasma has enabled us to create a modulation field that provides a more consistent level of energy with each plasma shot.

name: Plasma Thrower
description: Containing the unstable plasma in an energy modulation field allows for the potential to 'throw' the plasma over large distances, bursting upon impact.

name: Plasma Arc Emitter
description: Initial research into low-powered arcing plasma weaponry has shown some promising results. The weapon itself has relatively low power and penetration, but it hits an area - allowing for smaller targets to completely succumb to the plasma's effects.

name: Plasma Arc Launcher
description: Further research into arcing plasma weaponry should allow for increased power efficiency and damage, as well as a more sustainable plasma arc.

name: Warp Plasma Solar Arc
description: Weaponising the unstable and dangerous warp plasma created by propulsion systems allows for large arcing areas where vessels simply cannot exist.

name: Magnetic-Constraint Plasma Chamber
description: Attempts to increase the range of plasma based weaponry often come up with the same problems, dispersal of plasma and decrease of potency over time. By containing the plasma beam for as long as possible by magnetic constrainment we can improve the effectiveness of the beam over large distances.

name: Reinforced Plasma Chamber
description: The inherent instability of plasma is what makes it a potent weapon. By researching new methods of containing the plasma in its unstable state, we can ensure the most potent plasma is released.

name: Planck-Temperature Plasma Chamber
description: Improvements to the containment fields and plasma generation allow for the containment of temperatures that are beyond just 'heat'. At this stage, they are reaching Absolute Hot, the temperature at which the Planck lengths were first formed during the birth of the universe.

name: Coherent Pulsar Cannon
description: The pulsar cannon is a type of highly-enhanced weapon that, when launched, continuously draws energy from its target, becoming more and more powerful, until it impacts the target with the absorbed energy.

name: Charged Pulsar Cannon
description: Charged energy from magnetic bottles can potentially be sheathed in a pulsar shell, allowing it to continuously draw energy from its target, becoming more and more powerful, until it impacts the target with the absorbed energy.

name: Plasmatic Pulsar Cannon
description: Unstable plasma can potentially be sheathed in a pulsar shell, allowing it to continuously draw energy from its target, becoming more and more powerful, until it impacts the target with the absorbed energy.

name: Forced Plasma Beam
description: Improvements to the magnetic containment technology used in our plasma weaponry has led to the theory that a beam can retain a brief 'memory' if constrained by electromagnetic charges. By forcing this beam along a path, we can increase the effectiveness substantially over large distances.

name: Sustained Heat Beam
description: A heat beam is a form of focused, infrared energy that can be directed at a specific target. Whilst they have a high energy requirement, the heat beam works by exciting the molecules at the point of contact, disrupting the bonds that hold the structure in place. Research on how to maintain a solid beam over a period of time is required.

name: Planck Temperature Heat Beam
description: Improvements to the coordination of the focused energy allows for pinpoints of temperature that are beyond just 'heat'. At this stage, they are reaching Absolute Hot, the temperature at which the Planck lengths were first formed during the birth of the universe.

name: Plasma Wave
description: Initial research into the idea of projecting a wave of plasma into a magnetically-confined cone out from a point. Once fully primed, the highly compressed plasma causes severe structural damage to any enemy unlucky enough to still be located within the cone. Whilst devastating, distant targets are spared the full brunt of the impact, as the plasma quickly spreads out over a wider area.

name: Plasma Fog
description: Plasma weaponry often causes damage after a battle due to its caustic effects. By researching the corrosive processes and improving upon them, we may be able to increase its potency.

name: Plasma Miasma
description: Plasma weaponry often causes damage after a battle due to its caustic effects, spreading out over a larger area than the inital target. By utilising these effects, we can create a miasma that applies damage over a larger area.

name: Plasma Nimbus
description: Plasma weaponry often causes damage after a battle due to its caustic effects, spreading out over a larger area than the inital target. By utilising these effects, we can create a nimbus that applies damage over a larger area.

name: Platform-Mounted Heavy Plasma Cannon
description: Miniaturisation of plasma cannons is now possible, but it remains highly unstable and potentially explosive due to the inherent nature of unstable plasma. On the other hand, maximisation of plasma cannons should allow for very powerful blasts.

name: Mounted Forced Plasma Cannon
description: By forcing plasma through the tight lanes of a mounted cannon, we can create a highly destructive weapon mount that fires extremely-high-temperature plasma at enemy targets.

name: Mounted Warp Plasma Cannon
description: Mounting unstable warp plasma within a cannon is a highly dangerous, but destructive, weapon.

name: Paralithium-Powered Disruptor Pistol
description: Paralithium cells could be miniturised and used within handheld disruptor technology to provide a much more potent and lethal pistol.

name: Plasma Weaponry Breakthrough
description: Plasma weapon technology has served us well. The development of new forms of firing mechanisms has given us a choice. Developments in covariant resistant phase discriminators can be used as the lynchpin of a new phased plasma weapon. Alternatively, breakthroughs in industrial plasma compression and containment technology can be copied and adapted to create highly compressed plasma weapons.

name: Tunneling Plasma Cannon
description: Harnessing the expertise we have in quantum theory, we are almost capable of producing a highly compressed tunneling beam of plasma that could potentially exhibit a great deal of armour penetration.

name: Compressed Plasma Cannon
description: Compressed pulses of plasma focus their destructive potential on a smaller area, causing more damage to the hull than phased plasma pulses. They are expected to be significantly less effective against shields, which can be modulated to use the tension in the pulse to trigger decompression. When a pulse decompresses, its energy will harmlessly dissipate.

name: Tunneling Plasma Tri-Cannon
description: As component miniaturisation advances, the benefit of changing to dual barrels has not been forgotten. Smaller components should allow a triple-barreled cannon to be built. The latest advances in plasma compression involve using graviton infusions. Simulations suggest that weaponising this technique could make it harder for enemy armour to deflect the pulses.

name: Compressed Plasma Tri-Cannon
description: As component miniaturisation advances, the benefit of changing to dual barrels has not been forgotten. Smaller components should allow a triple-barreled cannon to be built. The latest advances in plasma compression involve using graviton infusions. Simulations suggest that weaponising this technique could make it harder for enemy shields to prematurely decompress the plasma pulse.

name: Tunneling Plasma Hyper-Cannon
description: As component miniaturisation advances, the benefit of changing to dual barrels has not been forgotten. Smaller components should allow a triple-barreled cannon to be built. The latest advances in plasma compression involve using graviton infusions. Simulations suggest that weaponising this technique could make it harder for enemy armour to deflect the pulses.

name: Compressed Plasma Hyper-Cannon
description: Controlling the phase of the plasma pulse allows us to create an electromagnetic shock wave upon impact with a target. The EM radiation interferes with and disrupt the target's EPS and electrical systems, causing damage, regardless of their defences. By encasing the intermix chambers with an antimatter sheath, we should be able to fire these cannons with an exit velocity beyond the speed of light.

name: Tunneling Plasma Autocannon Grid
description: Controlling the phase of the plasma bolts allows for smaller blasts of plasma to impact key points across the opponent's hull.

name: Compressed Plasma Autocannon Grid
description: The fixed barrels of previous cannons can be replaced with a set of rotating barrels. The primary advantage is that only one firing mechanism is required, allowing a larger and more complex firing system if required. As the barrels rotate, they can be flushed with coolant to reduce heat damage. Higher performance plasma compression units have reduced the diameter of the plasma pulses even further.

name: Tunneling Plasma Autocannon Matrix
description: Controlling the phase of the plasma bolts and tunnelling into a powerful blast allows for a powerful blasts of plasma to impact key points across the opponent's hull.

name: Compressed Plasma Autocannon Matrix
description: The fixed barrels of previous cannons can be replaced with a set of rotating barrels. The primary advantage is that only one firing mechanism is required, allowing a larger and more complex firing system if required. As the barrels rotate, they can be flushed with coolant to reduce heat damage. Higher performance plasma compression units have reduced the diameter of the plasma pulses even further.

name: Pakled Grapping Hooks
description: Pakleds need more stuff to make ships go, and make ships go faster. Grappling hooks stop other ships going so that we can get their parts for ourselves. Then our ships go fast.

name: Weaponised Cutting Beam
description: Our current generation of weapons are cumbersome, power hungry and destructive. They are imperfect. A new weapon has been devised, a high-powered laser cutting beam, that may destroy a target with ease but also allows us to dissect them for easier assimilation.

name: Enhanced Cutting Beam
description: Initial attempts at creating a laser-based cutting weapon have been moderately successful. To maintain efficiency, the cutting beam operates for a short period before regenerating. A sustained cutting beam can be created by reducing the frequency of emitter regeneration, adding additional emitters per node, and developing a new coolant suited for long-term operation.

name: Main Tactical Node
description: The main tactical node ensures priority is given to critical combat calculations during combat situations.

name: Reinforced Cutting Beam
description: Sustained cutting beams have proven a worthy investment, increasing our efficiency at assimilating hundreds of new species. Study of assimilated vessels built from these materials has suggested that a combination of improvements will be required. We should begin by adding additional power distribution nodes to the cutting beam, to increase peak power availability.

name: Secondary Tactical Node
description: A secondary coprocessing tactical node allows for non-critical calculations to be performed whilst not interfering with main systems.

name: Modulated Cutting Beam
description: Some species can be forced to submit to assimilation via a short display of psychologically disturbing force. The cutting beam can be adapted for this purpose by allowing it to be remodulated into a wide beam disintegrator. The beam's power will be spread over the target's hull, instantly vapourising large sections of outer plating, instead of cutting into it.

name: Warp Plasma Infused EPS Relay
description: The EPS relays and conduits are infused with plasma from the warp core, allowing for larger power usage during battle.

name: Harmonic Resonance Cutting Beam
description: The threshold of what is considered assimilation worthy increases as we assimilate more species and technology. The previous enhancements to the cutting beam's modulation subprocessor will facilitate a variety of experiments. Based on simulations, the most promising enhancement will be to force the cutting beam's photons into harmonic resonance, increasing cutting power.

name: High-Focusing Time-Crystal Array
description: This targeting array utilises time-crystals to enable precision targeting. Whilst normal crystals repeat their pattern in space but remain unchanged in time, time-crystals repeat themselves in time too, enabling us to utilise the crystals to target objects at optimal locations in time. In effect, the Collective can see where they are the instant they arrive - with no effect from time dilation.

name: Tri-Reinforced Cutting Beam
description: Species 13538 temporarily resisted assimilation by using a multi-density shield geometry set to the inverse harmonic frequency of our cutting beams. We need to adapt our cutting beams to overcome this weakness. Research should begin on rebuilding the cutting beams to use 3 laser projectors, creating a composite tri-beam, and assigning a separate multi-spatial tensor matrix.

name: Nanite-Infused Focusing Arrays
description: Perfecting the firing cadence of laser weaponry is a complex task that can be iteratively improved by ever increasingly complex calculations.

name: Flash coolant
description: Iterative advances in heat dispersion improving the stability and efficiency of the Collective's weapons systems, ensuring maximal fire rate.

name: Miniaturized Pre-Igniters
description: Advances in miniaturisation allow for more rapid loading and discharging of torpedo payloads.

name: Thermodynamic Yield Control
description: With the warhead explosive reaction tightly controlled by missile-board microprocessors, warhead detonations can be tuned for maximum effect for local conditions at the time of impact.

name: Bio-Pulse Weapon
description: Biopulse weapons can be grown that fire powerful energetic bolts from the hull of our living bioships that could be destructive to enemy ships.

name: Bio-Pulse Beam Weapon
description: Improvements to the growth of bio-pulse weaponry allow for sustained beams rather than short bursts.

name: Organic Tactical Node
description: An organic tactical node allows for non-critical processes to be performed whilst not interfering with main biological functions.

name: Bio Proton Pulse Beam
description: Mixing the standard biopulse with the positively charged protons within this universe cause an improved reaction upon impact.

name: Directed Energy Weapon
description: A directed-energy weapon is a theoretical weapon system that inflicts damage at a target by emission of highly focused energy, including laser, microwaves, and particle beams.

name: Bio Antiproton Beam
description: Mixing the standard biopulse with the negatively charged antiprotons within this universe cause an improved reaction upon impact.

name: Directed Bio Pulse
description: By combining the bio pulse with highly focused energy, it may be possible to create a directed bio pulse for highly accurate damaging shots.

name: Fluidic Antiproton Weapon
description: Mixing antiprotonic weaponry from this universe with antiprotonic weaponry from our own fluidic universe creates a highly unstable, yet powerful, beam that can be produced from our bioships.

name: Directed Fluidic Pulse
description: The research into this universe's particles and microwaves has resulted in directed fluidic energy. Theoretically it should be possible to weaponise this.

name: Extradimensional Antiproton Weapon
description: Drawing energy directly from our own dimension allows for our bioships to fire almost continuously with powerful antiprotonic weaponry.

name: Bio-Lense Focusing Arrays
description: Perfecting the firing cadence of biopulse weaponry is a complex task that can be improved by ever complex evolution.

name: Flash coolant
description: Evolutionary advances in heat dispersion improve the stability and efficiency of weapons, ensuring maximal fire rate.

name: Miniaturized Pre-Igniters
description: Advances in miniaturisation allow for more rapid loading and discharging of torpedo payloads.

name: Focusing Arrays
description: Perfecting the firing cadence of biopulse weaponry is a complex task that can be improved by ever complex evolution.

name: Undine Planet Killer
description: By focusing the energy of a nearby bioship upon the absorbing hull of a focusing vessel, we can improve the devastation of our beams by a magnitude of 10. Further research is required into the multiplicative effect of numerous bioships firing upon a single focusing target.

name: Planet Ravager
description: The combination of biopulse weaponry into one stream allows the surface of a planet to be ravaged and cleansed.

name: Metreon Energy Weapon
description: A metreon is a particle which can take the form of both radiation and gas. Metreon particles have been demonstrated to react with dark matter and even to have temporal properties. In their gaseous form, metreon particles are extremely volatile and are easily ignited via weapons fire.

name: Metreon Plasma Beam
description: The metreonic radiation could potentially be directed into a beam when combined with plasma; however, the stability of this would be extremely poor.

name: Metreon Plasma Launcher
description: Bursts of plasma can contain more metreonic radiation and particles; however, they remain particularly unstable.

name: Focused Dark Matter Beam
description: By combining the reactive metreon particles with a focused dark matter beam, it may be possible to ignite the metreon particles and cause a cascade reaction.

name: Excited Dark Matter Beam
description: Improvements to the dark matter beam emitters allow the pre-excitement of the dark matter, resulting in much more potent and rapid destructive potential.

name: Metreon Fountain
description: The combination of dark matter and metreon particles has resulted in the creation of metreon isotopes. Their half-life is very short, but they do emit large amounts of energy.

name: Metreon Cascade
description: A potentially galaxy changing weapon, the cascade uses unstable metreon isotopes to create a devastating explosion. The resulting radiation poisoning will likely kill those who are not destroyed by the initial blast.

name: Metreonic Lance
description: The metreonic lance is a large, fixed-mount weapon that utilises extremely high energy to create a metreon cascade reaction at long ranges.

name: Subspace Radiation Weapon
description: Subspace radiation is a form of radiation associated with subspace phenomena. By turning into a weapon, it should be possible to create weaponry with warp field collapsing properties.

name: Lower-Subspace Radiation Weapon
description: Further developments in subspace research have come across a lower subspace band below the initial layer of subspace. Radiation and particles are much more potent and unstable than regular subspace.

name: Higher-Subspace Radiation Weapon
description: Breaching through lower-subspace has given thought to a band of subspace that is in a dimension higher than our own. The potential from breaching higher-subspace could be immense.

name: Subspace Disruption Field Projector
description: Subspace radiation is a form of radiation associated with subspace phenomena. By projecting the radiation across an area, it should be possible to create a field with warp field collapsing properties.

name: Isolytic Charge
description: Composed of a large matter-antimatter charge surrounded by a set of concentric shells composed of Verterium Cortenide and Tungsten-Cobalt-Magnesium, the Isolytic charge is a powerful, yet unpredictable, weapon. In many cases, subspace tears form as the isolytic charges break holes in the spacetime continuum.

name: Isolytic Energy Beam
description: Using the power of isolytic weaponry, it should be possible to utilise the side effect of subspace tears forming to shred enemy vessels.

name: Anti-Proton Beam
description: Firing bursts of anti-protons, these cannons are capable of partially dissolving their target at a subatomic level. Energy released from the annihilation of the targets protons by the anti-protons causes a heating effect, pushing the remaining particles apart causing further damage.

name: Antimatter Spread
description: There has been a boom of experimental antimatter weapons. Inevitably most are flawed, but a flak style weapon using antimatter pellets has passed several key tests. The pellets have been shown to burn through dense armour with ease. However, data suggests that the pellet's low mass means they can be easily deflected by shields. Further research should lead to a field ready prototype.

name: Extended Antimatter Spread
description: Advances to flak dispersal and custom-designed antimatter pellets could lead to improvements in the usage of antimatter spreads. Still easily deflected by shielding, the pellets should at least cover a larger area.

name: Red Field
description: Containing the antimatter pellets within regular matter sheaths, courtesy of containment fields, should allow for improved shield penetration and dispersal of antimatter particles.

name: The Deadly Crimson Field
description: Initially a theoretical fallacy, the deadly crimson field has become a potential reality by splitting the hydrogen atoms that sheath the antimatter into a large area, resulting in thousands of tiny atomic explosions across an area.

name: Antimatter Weaponry Principles
description: The principles of antimatter weapons are to utilise devices using antimatter as a power source, propellant, or explosive.

name: Antiproton Pylon
description: Like most weapons, anti-proton emitters have a limited firing arc. Traditionally, this is overcome with a weapons grid spanning the starbase's hull, but this wastes a lot of power. It is possible to design pylons which stick out from the station, allowing a smaller number of anti-proton emitters to cover a wider area. Clustering the emitters will have the effect of simplifying the supply network.

name: Rapid Antimatter Breeder Chamber
description: The rapid annihilation of anti-matter when it comes into contact with the physical world is well known. The ability to quickly and rapidly create anti-matter for use within weaponry requires new research into breeder chambers.

name: Antimatter Relay
description: With the invention of rapid anti-matter breeder chambers, it should now be possible to shunt anti-matter directly into the weaponry, allowing for potent beams capable of annihilating enemy vessels rapidly.

name: Antimatter Blast
description: Utilising the technology found in a Doomsday Device, we may be able to reverse engineer the weapon technology found in its planet killing beam. Initial tests show its destructive potential is beyond anything we have ever seen.

name: Positron Cannon
description: Phase inverting electrons in the antimatter intermix-chamber has allowed for the creation of positrons, which, when weaponised correctly, could be used to make a destructive ship-mounted cannon.

name: Muon Blaster Cannon
description: A blaster is a type of ranged weapon that fires bolts of intense energy, often mistaken as lasers. Operating under the same principles as laser weaponry, muon blasters convert energy-rich gas to a glowing muon particle beam that can melt through targets.

name: Gluon Blaster Cannon
description: A blaster is a type of ranged weapon that fires bolts of intense energy, often mistaken as lasers. Operating under the same principles as laser weaponry, gluon blasters convert energy-rich gas to a glowing gluon particle beam that can melt through targets.

name: Sheathed AM Penetrators
description: Taking inspiration from obsolete ballistic weapons, ideas have been posed for a graviton propellant antimatter slug launcher. Fired at high velocity, the slugs will not only be harder for shields to deflect and will have excellent range too. A containment sheath is required to stop the slug annihilating before it embeds in the targets armour, where it will cause significant damage to their hull.

name: Sheathed AM Gauss Cannon
description: Even with a containment sheath, the antimatter slugs are delicate. Examining the data from field uses of the weapon should inform us on how to create a stronger containment sheath.
