Stronger sheaths will allow us to upgrade the firing mechanism to propel the slug through a series of high power electromagnetic coils.

name: Sheathed AM Hyperluminal Railgun
description: Advancements in gas state railgun technology and antimatter sheaths allow for the projectiles to be fired to a speed many times the speed of light.

name: Platform-Mounted Heavy Antimatter Beam
description: Fixed platforms provide a stable platform for weaponry. Breeder chambers built into the platform can quickly replenish antimatter supplies, allowing for a sustained bombardment of antimatter beams.

name: Mounted Heavy Muon Cannon
description: Operating under the same principles as laser weaponry, mounted muon blasters convert energy-rich gases into a glowing muon particle beam that can melt through targets.

name: Fixed-Mount Gluon Cannon
description: Operating under the same principles as laser weaponry, mounted gluon blasters convert energy-rich gas to a glowing gluon particle beam that can melt through targets.

name: Antiproton Weaponry Breakthrough
description: Our weapon technology has served us well. The development of new forms of firing mechanisms has given us a choice. Developments in covariant resistant phase modulators can be used as the lynchpin of new antiproton weapons. Alternatively, breakthroughs in industrial plasma compression and containment technology can be copied and adapted to create highly compressed proton cannons.

name: Antiphoton Beam
description: Anti-photons are a prime candidate for being the basis of a new weapon. A concentrated beam of anti-photons will partially penetrate a shield. It can even pass through several layers of armour, reducing its effectiveness. Anti-photons are easy to create in large numbers, removing the requirement for them to be held in storage.

name: Tunneling Proton Beam
description: Controlling the phase of the charged proton beams allows for smaller beams of protons to impact key points across the opponent's hull.

name: Antiphoton Bank
description: Our prototype anti-photon beam emitters have been used across our starship's hulls. While this gives a range of firing arcs for the number of emitters, it limits their effective power. Grouping our emitters into a smaller number of banks will concentrate their firepower, increasing combat effectiveness. Additionally, we can fit a dioptic manifold to improve the beams convergence on a single point.

name: Tunneling Proton Beam Bank
description: Grouping the emitters into banks, whilst controlling the phase of the charged proton beams, allows for smaller beams of protons to impact key points across the opponent's hull.

name: Antiphoton Array
description: Anti-photon beam weapons have traditionally been arranged into banks of a small number of emitters. Anti-photon beam arrays contain a much a larger number of emitters, providing a direct firepower increase. Using multiple emitters to fire the collected anti-photons allows a triaxilating modulation to be used. Triaxilating anti-photons can disrupt the targets shield emitters.

name: Tunneling Proton Beam Array
description: Using multiple emitters in an array, whilst controlling the phase of the charged proton beams, allows for smaller beams of protons to impact key points across the opponent's hull.

name: Antiphoton Higher-Freq Matrix
description: The creation of our honeycomb-like matrices has led to new avenues of research. One such experiment is the incremental shift of frequencies to higher and higher levels due to the introduction of frictionless surfaces and organic superlubricants.

name: Tunneling Proton Beam High-Freq Matrix
description: The creation of our honeycomb-like matrices has led to new avenues of research. One such experiment is the incremental shift of frequencies to higher and higher levels which should penetrate through the armour of enemy vessels.

name: Nanite-Driven Focusing Arrays
description: With the warhead explosive reaction tightly boosted by missile-board microprocessors, warhead detonations can be tuned for maximum effect for local conditions at the time of impact.

name: Quantum coolant
description: Iterative advances in heat dispersion improving the stability and efficiency of the Collective's weapons systems, ensuring maximal fire rate.

name: Miniaturised Pre-Ignition Chamber
description: Advances in miniaturisation allow for more rapid loading and discharging of torpedo payloads.

name: Thermodynamic Yield Drive
description: With the warhead explosive reaction tightly controlled by missile-board microprocessors, warhead detonations can be tuned for maximum effect for local conditions at the time of impact.

name: Proton Rifles
description: Our initial research into antiprotons has given insight into how these extremely damaging weapons can be used in a handheld capacity. Further research will be required to utilise this to its full advantage.

name: Antimatter Automated Defense Battery
description: Starship antimatter weapons could be adapted for use in defensive weapon emplacements against orbital bombing and invasion. Several technical details need to be worked out first. The most difficult being how to power them, without leaving them vulnerable and how to solve the atmospheric diffusion that limits their range.

name: Mobile Antimatter Bomb Artillery
description: Capacitor technology increases and miniaturisation allow for the reduction of ship-mounted antimatter weaponry to a mobile, ground suitable device. Firing small bursts of antimatter in a large arc results in low cooling requirements and heavy damage potential.

name: Subspace Surge Projector
description: As vessels shield their propulsion system against subspace radiation, more powerful subspace generators are required to store and then surge energy across an area, disrupting their warp fields.

name: Subspace Fracture Projector
description: A major step in warp field disruption, the ability to create subspace fractures in real space can disrupt warp energy across large areas.

name: Polaron Beam
description: Polarons are a quasiparticle. With our current understanding of physics, we believe that we can create a directional beam that consists of ions, and electrons acting as polarons. If the polaron is strong enough, we hope to induce a kind of 'charge shock' in the atomic structure of the target. A powerful enough 'shock' should cause the atomic structure to disintegrate.

name: Neutronic Beam
description: Certain particles will generate high-energy neutrons when they impact together on a shield or solid surface. A weapon firing beams of these exotic particles will be highly destructive. The generation and expansion of waves of neutrons inside the shield's graviton layers will be even more destructive than current polaron weapons.

name: Neutronic Polarized Beam
description: With some work, it might be possible to find a combination of exotic particles that can sustain polarons. The polarons should reduce the target's atomic cohesion, increasing the destructive effective of the neutron waves.

name: Neutronic Reverse-Polarity Beam
description: By reversing the polarity via a phase inverter, our neutronic beams should further destabilize the atomic cohesion of any target.

name: Phased Neutronic-Polaron Beam
description: Interplexing the neutronic beams to put them out of phase will further destabilize the atomic cohesion of a target.

name: Neutronic Lance
description: Neutronic weapons are directed energy weapons that are saturated with radiolytic isotopes. By affixing mounts to vessels, we could create a lance of neutronic energy.

name: Polaron Pylon
description: While emitters limited firing arcs work for starships, starbases cannot manoeuvre to bring their weapons to bear. Traditionally this is overcome with a weapons grid spanning the starbases hull, but this wastes a lot of power. It is possible to design pylons which stick out from the station, allowing a smaller number of polaron emitters to cover a wider area.

name: Polaron Emitter
description: Further polaron research has resulted in large emitters that can blast rapid bursts of polaron quasiparticles across an area.

name: Polaron Modulator Grid
description: The often-unstable nature of polaron weaponry requires modulation by the vessel. By installing a modulation grid into the emitters, it should be possible to fire powerful and rapid blasts of polaron energy at targets.

name: Polaron Spear
description: Fixed mounts and cooling brackets allow for extremely-high-energy polaron bursts, blasting quasiparticles across large distances.

name: Focused Polaron Beam
description: Polaron beams were found to have an unexpected quality; they can partially penetrate shields. This is a by-product of the polarons' interaction with the graviton layers in the shield. Physics models updated with this information now suggest that decreasing the size of the beam's focal point could actually disrupt the graviton layer it hits. An increase to shield damage can be expected.

name: Multi-Polar Charged Beam
description: We have long aspired to create a weapon capable of firing a beam composed of multiple polarities of polarons, as previous efforts have failed due to polarons disrupting each other. Generations of manufacturing these weapons have finally shown us a solution. The most significant change to the weapon will be the use of multiple polaron generators to coat the beam in differently charged polarons.

name: Reverse-Polarity Charged Beam
description: Attempts at improving multi-polar beam weapons have incidentally led to polaron generators that can flip their polarisation while live. Polaron weapons using these generators can invert the polarity of the entire beam while firing. If we can create a weapon that flips polarity several times a second, the added 'charge shock' should inflict more damage.

name: Platform-Mounted Heavy Polaron Beam
description: Focused heavy polaron beams can be utilised upon starbases to cause extremely potent long-range polaron attacks.

name: Mounted Multi-Polar Beam
description: The most significant change to the installation of this fixed mount weapon will be the use of multiple polaron generators to coat the beam in differently charged polarons.

name: Fixed-Mount Reverse Polarity Beam
description: Large polaron generators can be installed upon starbases which can flip their polarisation whilst live, resulting in a beam that flips polarity rapidly, adding charge shock to the target.

name: Anti-Coagulant Enriched Polaron Bolt
description: Sometimes when hunting those who oppose the will of the Founders, the Jem'Hadar can only score a wounding blow. If our weapons were to leave a residual charge that prevented the Solid's blood from clotting, any wound could potentially be fatal.

name: Polaron Weaponry Breakthrough
description: Combat strategists are becoming increasingly vocal about the weakness of relying on a single type of polaron weapon. If a countermeasure is found, our forces would become combat ineffective. Research departments have been working on new weapon designs and put forward some prototypes for our inspection.

name: Charged Polaron Beam
description: Continued development of the polaron coil allows us to integrate polaron beams from multiple emitters into a single beam. Using a polaron coil, we can build a weapon that fires a beam of differently phased polarons. Theoretically, the phased polaron beam would create a localised disruption in the target's shield. This will allow it to pass through and cause significant damage to the hull.

name: Neutral Particle Weaponry
description: A class of charged neutral particle weapons would solve our polaron dependency problem. Initially thought to be too primitive to be effective, it was soon found that modern particle accelerators can be weaponised to create a beam capable of inflicting significant kinetic damage. Weaponising these accelerators should be an easy task.

name: Charged Polaron Beam Bank
description: Our prototype phased polaron beam emitters have been used across our starships' hulls. Grouping our emitters into a smaller number of banks will concentrate their firepower, increasing combat effectiveness. The simultaneous impacts of multiple polaron beams will be harder for enemy defences to stop.

name: Neutral Particle Weapon Bank
description: Our prototype particle beam emitters have been used across our starships' hulls. Grouping our emitters into a smaller number of banks will concentrate their firepower, increasing combat effectiveness. This will require improvements to the particle accelerators, so that they work when positioned close together. Hopefully advances here will lay the foundation for even denser emitter formations.

name: Charged Polaron Array
description: By integrating a prefiring chamber for the polaron quasiparticles, the resulting blast should impact targets with charged polarons, allowing for substantial destructive output, especially at a subatomic level.

name: Particle Weapon Array
description: Neutral particle beam weapons have traditionally been arranged into banks of a small number of emitters. Neutral particle beam arrays contain a much a larger number of emitters, providing a direct firepower increase. Neutral particles are more difficult to triaxilate than charged particles, but doing so reduces the amount of their energy that is wasted on impact.

name: High-Dimension Phased Polaron Matrix
description: Experiments with artificial wormholes have only ever produced small, unstable wormholes. Often seen as useless, we have come to realise that if weaponised, they offer great potential. It might even be possible to manipulate certain characteristics of the wormhole to adjust the phase of the polaron beam. The phase coils at the cavity aperture could then be shut down, saving a little power.

name: High-Dimension Particle Weapon Matrix
description: Unlocking new dimensions of particle beam manipulation, this technology leverages the power of artificial wormholes. Through precise manipulation of quantum dimensions, the matrix harnesses the inherent volatility of wormholes to achieve unprecedented destructive capabilities. By exploiting hidden aspects of higher-dimensional physics, the matrix embodies a revolutionary step forward in energy manipulation and combat strategy.

name: High-Dimension Hyper Phased Polaron Matrix
description: Elevating particle manipulation, this technology harnesses artificial wormholes to enhance polaron beam capabilities. By exploiting higher-dimensional geometry, the matrix amplifies quantum fluctuations for unprecedented power and versatility. A milestone in energy manipulation.

name: High-Dimension Phased Particle Weapon Matrix
description: Pushing the boundaries of particle manipulation, this technology harnesses the power of higher dimensions to enhance combat capabilities. By exploiting quantum fluctuations in wormholes, the matrix achieves unparalleled control over particle beams, solidifying its advanced status in energy manipulation.

name: Experimental Phased Particle Weapon Matrix
description: Breakthroughs in the experimental artificial wormhole production of polarons have been stablised thanks to work of our scientists. The gravition's have produced a higher yield and a more stablised detonation.

name: Experimental Phased Particle Weapon Matrix
description: Experimental Phased Particle Weapon Matrix developed by our scientists to increase our weapon yield and power.

name: Polaron Automated Defense Battery
description: Starship polaron weapons could be adapted for use in defensive weapon emplacements against orbital bombing and invasion. Several technical details need to be worked out first. The most difficult being how to power them, without leaving them vulnerable and how to solve the atmospheric diffusion that limits their range.

name: Mobile Heavy-Duty Polaron Artillery
description: Capacitor technology increases and miniaturisation allow for the reduction of ship-mounted polaron cannons to a mobile, ground suitable device. Firing small bursts of polarons in a rotating Gatling configuration results in low cooling requirements and heavy damage potential.

name: Quantum Resonance Charge
description: A quantum resonance signature is a specific measurement that exists for all forms of matter. Calculations suggest that utilising subatomic particles to disrupt the quantum resonance of a target could be extremely beneficial to our military units.

name: Resonance Charge
description: Improvements in power levels allow for the construction of a resonance charge to disrupt the quantum resonance signature of our opponents. A larger charge could potentially disrupt an entire vessel's cohesion.

name: Harmonic Resonance Charge
description: Scanning and matching a resonance charge to the optimal frequency to disrupt an opponent's quantum resonance signature will increase weapon potential by a large factor.

name: Quantum Manifold Resonance Charge
description: A manifold charging grid could potentially increase the amount of resonance frequencies contained within a resonance charge, thus provoking heavy instability but increasing the damage potential greatly.

name: Quantum Matrix Resonance Charge
description: Solving the instabilities contained with resonance charges has often led to a decrease in weapon potentiality and is thus undesirable. By solving the bioquantum mathematics involved in resonance field creation, we can create charges that are created from an entire matrix of capacitor banks, resulting in massive damage potential.

name: Quantum D-Brane Resonance Charge
description: Superstring mechanics propose that each dimension has a quantum resonance signature which can be exploited to disrupt an enemy vessel's shields and hull on a dimensional level.

name: Thermic Charge
description: Our efforts to cure the phage have resulted in some interesting byproducts, one of which is the thermic charge. Originally an industrial tool that heats and melts metals in the presence of pressurized oxygen to create the very high temperatures required for cutting, it has been repurposed for starship weaponry.

name: Enriched Thermic Charge
description: As our understanding of physics increases, we begin to work with higher and higher temperatures. This allows for the introduction of higher energy, heavy thermic charges.

name: Superheated Thermic Charge
description: As our understanding of physics increases, we begin to work with higher and higher temperatures. The creation of a superheated core allows for the introduction of higher-energy thermic charges.

name: White-Hole Blaster
description: As our understanding of physics increases, we begin to work with higher and higher temperatures. The creation of superheating techniques at this level create miniature white holes in space time, heat so strong that matter flows from the white hole.

name: Hyper-Thermic Charge
description: As our understanding of physics increases, we begin to work with higher and higher temperatures. Further refinements of temperatures at this level offer glimpses at what could possibly be 'Absolute Hot'.

name: Planck Temperature Thermic Charge
description: Improvements to the coordination of the focused energy allows for pinpoints of temperature that are beyond just 'heat'. At this stage, the charges are reaching Absolute Hot, the temperature at which Planck lengths were first formed during the birth of the universe.

name: Chroniton Cannon
description: Chroniton cannons are ship-mounted weapons utilized by the Krenim, deadly weapons based on temporal science. The chronitons in a blast are capable of passing directly through an enemy's shields, due to the fact that they are in a constant state of temporal flux.

name: Chronometric Chroniton Cannon
description: Adjustments to the chroniton cannon allow for each blast to be in a slightly different targeting phase, resulting in increased damage when impacting a target.

name: Time-Shifted Chroniton Cannon
description: Impacts from blasts with this chroniton weapon can theoretically fracture a vessel into different time periods, upon which the resultant stress can wreak havoc on enemy systems and structural integrity.

name: Chronometric Capacitor
description: One problem that our research teams have been having is the question of 'How do you store space-time?'. By amplifying a stasis field and passing the particles through an antimatter field to separate the chronitons from their substrate place in the universe, we can store large amounts of chronometric energy within one of these chronometric capacitors.

name: Temporal Wake Cannon
description: Directed temporal core energy can potentially be directed into a weapon that will ricochet throughout time, disrupting space-time around the impact point.

name: Annoraxian Temporal Wake Weapon
description: Further research into directed temporal core energy can create a weapon that will ricochet throughout time, disrupting and even erasing space-time around the impact point.

name: Tetryonic Cannon
description: Rapid-fire cannons that fire pulses of tetryon particles. Tetryons are native to subspace; once extruded into normal space they become unstable, making them useful as a weapon. A high rate of fire compensates for a lack of accuracy.

name: Tetryonic Pulse Cannon
description: In order to increase the damage of the cannons, it is possible that firing smaller bursts of tetryons in large amounts can cause more damage. Capacitor technology increases allow for more charge per volley.

name: Tetryonic Gatling Cannon
description: To increase the rate of fire of tetryon cannons and to avoid overheating of the cannons, rotating barrel technology based on ancient Gatling principles can be utilised.

name: Tetryonic Weapon Principles
description: A tetryon is a subatomic particle that can only exist in subspace environments. Since these particles are a property of subspace, they become highly energetic and unstable when they are extruded into normal space, occurring by both natural and artificial means, such as with tetryonic weapons.

name: Tetryon Turret
description: Early versions of the tetryon turret have been promising. The addition of more capacitors to the pre-fire circuits will lengthen the turret firing time before having to recharge.

name: Secondary Subspace Manifold Extruder
description: The secondary subspace manifold is the first domain located in what we call subspace. The domain, which emits a subspace energy level of 6.2 keV, can possibly be exploited by creating an extruder which taps into it.

name: Tertiary Subspace Manifold Extruder
description: The tertiary subspace manifold is one of many domains located in the myriad layers of subspace. Many solanogen-based lifeforms call the tertiary subspace manifold their home, which emits a subspace energy level of 16.2 keV. By creating an extruder which taps into the tertiary subspace manifold, we can claim that energy for ourselves.

name: Tachyon Lance
description: A burst-operated beam that delivers a devastating lance of damage. Unlike regular beam weaponry, the tachyon stream is not lensed or altered in any way. The reaction takes on a life of its own, rapidly consuming stored capacitor power. When space is exposed to such high levels of anti-plasma, the electromagnetic, gravitic, and thermal cavitation effect shreds anything that stands in its way.

name: Tetryon Barbette
description: Tetryon cannon turrets are attached to the outside of a ship's hull. Lacking armour, they rely on being small enough that hostile vessels cannot maintain an accurate weapons lock. Providing an armoured barbette for the turret will remove the size requirement, allowing for larger plasma conduits to be used.

name: Tetryon Gatling
description: In order to increase the damage of the cannons, it is possible that firing smaller bursts of tetryons in large amounts can cause more damage. Capacitor technology increases allow for more charge per volley.

name: Tetryon Autocannon Grid
description: The fixed barrels of previous cannons can be replaced with a set of rotating barrels. The primary advantage is that only one firing mechanism is required, allowing for a larger and more complex firing system. As the barrels rotate, they can be flushed with coolant to reduce heat damage. Higher performance plasma compression units have reduced the diameter of the tetryon bursts even further.

name: Graviton Beam
description: Manipulating streams of gravitons into a coherent beam allows for numerous stressors to be placed on a target area, literally tearing and shearing it apart via gravity.

name: Modulated Graviton Beam
description: Manipulating streams of gravitons into a coherent, confined beam allows for numerous stressors to be placed on a target area, literally tearing and shearing it apart via gravity. By modulating the frequency of the gravitons, we can increase damage through shields and hull.

name: Shearing Graviton Beam
description: Manipulating streams of gravitons into a coherent, confined beam allows for numerous stressors to be placed on a target area, literally tearing and shearing it apart via gravity.

name: Phase-Conjugate Graviton Beam
description: Manipulating streams of gravitons into a coherent, confined beam allows for numerous stressors to be placed on a target area, literally tearing and shearing it apart via gravity. By conjugating the phase of each graviton, we can increase the destructive potential of this weapon.

name: Heavy Tetryonic Gatling Cannon
description: The fixed barrels of previous cannons can be replaced with a set of rotating barrels in a Gatling configuration. The ability to fire a greater number of smaller tetryon pulses will reduce the proportion of the pulse that hits with suboptimal convergence.

name: Thoron Cannon
description: Utilising thorons, the radioactive isotope of radon, within our intermix chambers can increase the damage output of our cannons substantially.

name: Thoron Autocannon
description: In order to increase the damage of the cannons, it is possible that firing smaller bursts of thorons in large amounts can cause more damage. Capacitor technology increases allow for more charge per volley.

name: Turbo-Tetryon Emplacement
description: Bolstered tetryon emitters could potentially allow for a direct link to subspace in order to bombard targets with tetryonic radiation.

name: Graviton Beam Emplacement
description: Utilisation of subspace gravitons within a beam emplacement should allow for an accurate and damaging weapon, capable of transmitting gravitation force upon impact.

name: Tachyon Beam Emplacement
description: Utilisation of faster-than-light tachyons within a beam emplacement should allow for an accurate and damaging weapon.

name: Plasma Whip
description: Research into methods of control have some up with one extremely useful prototype. The energy whip is a hand-held weapon that, when lashed, fires a pulse of energy that stunned the target. It allows our enforcers to inflict their will without resorting to unprofitable lethal methods.

name: Weaponised Medical Scanner
description: Medical scanners are used to determine the level and severity of injuries within a body, but some researchers believe it could also be used to find anatomical weaknesses within an enemy.

name: Neural Disruptor
description: Our initial research into unstable particles has given insight into how these extremely damaging neural disruptors can be used in a handheld capacity. Further research will be required to utilise this to its full advantage

name: Tetryonic Weaponry Breakthrough
description: As technology advances and we develop new combat tactics, new weapons are required to fill specialist roles within our navy. Strategic commanders have devised specifications for a set of desired weapons. Limitations on our resources means that we'll only be able to pursue one of the final prototypes.

name: Modulated Tetryonic Cannon
description: Focusing our efforts on developing new subspace particle modulators will give us more precise control over the modulation of our tetryon-based weapons. This should allow our ships to modulate the tetryons to simultaneously pierce and disrupt the enemy's shield. In addition, it has been decided that developing this technology into a cannon-type weapon will best fit our needs.

name: Breaching Tetryonic Cannon
description: Focusing our efforts on developing banks of smaller, coordinated tetryon emitters will produce a weapon that can control the dispersal pattern of its energy. This versatility would make it effective against both shields and armour. To avoid complications, the weapon will be restricted to firing in short bursts at close range, making it ideal for mounting in a cannon frame.

name: Modulated Tetryonic Dual-Cannon
description: Prototype modulated tetryonic cannons have included a number of backup and redundant systems. Using the data obtained from field testing, it is possible to safely reduce the number of redundant components. The extra space will be used to mount a second barrel. Despite some significant variances in shield technologies, modulated tetryonic cannons have been effective at penetrating them all.

name: Breaching Tetryonic Dual-Cannon
description: Prototype breaching tetryonic cannons have included a number of backup and redundant systems. Using the data obtained from field testing, it is possible to safely reduce the number of redundant components. The extra space will be used to mount a second barrel. If more emitters could be brought to bear on a single convergence point then the damage potential could scale geometrically.

name: Modulated Tetryonic Tri-Cannon
description: The benefit of changing from a single barrel to dual barrel has not been forgotten. Using smaller components with higher tolerances should allow a triple-barreled cannon to be built. By reducing the output of each cannon slightly, a higher total output can be achieved. Each barrel uses its own emitters and can be individually modulated to keep up with remodulating shields.

name: Breaching Tetryonic Tri-Cannon
description: As component miniaturisation advances, the benefit of changing from a single barrel to dual barrel has not been forgotten. Experiments are being conducted to allow each barrel to be slightly adjusted independently of each other. It should allow all three barrels to be targeted at the same point. In ideal circumstances, this would increase armour penetration.

name: Modulated Tetryonic Autocannon Grid
description: The fixed barrels of previous cannons can be replaced with a set of rotating barrels. As the barrels rotate, they can be flushed with coolant to reduce heat damage. A prototype multi-stage modulation matrix has been built in order to maintain the rapid modulation characteristics of the tri-barrel cannon designs. The prototype will need testing before it can be approved for military applications.

name: Breaching Tetryonic Autocannon Grid
description: The fixed barrels of previous cannons can be replaced with a set of rotating barrels. The ability to fire a greater number of smaller tetryon pulses will reduce the proportion of the pulse that hits with suboptimal convergence. Convergence issues occur because of the change in distance between the cannon and target, which happens as the emitters are locked and the pulse is emitted.

name: Chronometric Focusing Array
description: Improving the scale of chronometric weaponry requires the introduction of an entire array that can be used to focus space-time across an entire spectrum.

name: Tetryon-Mount Automated Defence Battery
description: Defensive batteries can be outfitted with tetryon emitters, drawing the unstable particles from subspace and allowing for powerful tetryonic radiation bombardments.

name: Mobile Heavy-Duty Tetryon Artillery
description: Capacitor technology increases and miniaturisation allow for the reduction of ship-mounted tetryon cannons to a mobile, ground-suitable device. Firing small bursts of tetryons in a rotating Gatling configuration results in low cooling requirements and heavy damage potential.

name: Carpe Diem'-type Chroniton Cannon
description: When is the exact present? Is it now? Or now? By drawing on chronitons in phase with an exact moment in space-time, we can seize the energy in that one moment in time to disrupt moments in space-time across a wide spectrum.

name: Basic AI
description: The pursuit of AI is one fraught with practical, computational and philosophical difficulties, including moral hazards. Cautious development is however necessary to further scientific understanding.

name: Research Automation
description: Unlocks the power of research automation.

name: Reactive Bio Field
description: A field generated from the Undine pilot's mental strength channeled through the living ship creates a powerful defensive field.

name: Fluidic Generator
description: Specially applied concentrated bursts of nuclear energy against bio-matter generates powerful reactions that can be harvested for energy production.

name: Fluidic Amplification Reactor
description: Specially applied concentrated bursts of nuclear energy against bio-matter generates powerful reactions that can be harvested for energy production. This energy is then amplified using the psychic power of the Undine mind.

name: Fluidic Bio Reactor
description: Specially mixed concentrations of fluidic matter and bio-matter generates powerful waves of energy that can be used to power Undine Technology.

name: Psi Projection Generator
description: Mass detonation of biomass is harnest by the powerful minds of Undine engineers and directed towards powering their most powerful vessels.

name: Telepathic Tracing Node
description: Utilising the inherent bio-ship connection to the surrounding space, the Undine tap into their telepathic mastery to create specially created tracking nodes.

name: Improved Telepathic Tracing Node
description: Further development to the inherent bio-ship connection to the surrounding space, the Undine tap into their telepathic mastery to create specially created tracking nodes.

name: Advanced Telepathic Tracing Node
description: Maximising the the inherent bio-ship connection to the surrounding space, the Undine tap into their telepathic mastery to create the most tuned tracking nodes possible.

name: Subspace Traversal Matrix
description: The Aquatics have mastered the ability to traverse great distances as they once migrated the oceans of Xindus.

name: Xindi Hive Mind Interface
description: Unique to the Xindi based on Insectoid technology, the interface allows one individuals to control multiple ship functions.
